Presidents Day Mini-Camp.description:
Presidents Day Mini-Camp
Join us on President’s Day for our tribute to our favorite Presidents! Our Lil' Chefs will learn knife skills, how to follow and complete a recipe, and how to properly measure wet and dry ingredients. Our Menu: Kennedy’s Fettuccini Alfredo, Bush’s Cheeseburger Pizza and Washington’s Very Cherry Dessert.
FAQs
Is there an age limit to attend this cooking class?This cooking class is open to children ages 4 and up.
Is my child mature enough for this class?Your child needs to have developed fine motor skills and the ability to follow directions.
Is my registration/ticket transferrable?Event Fees for missed classes are non-refundable. However, if advanced notice is given, paid fees can be credited towards future events. A $5.00 fee will apply.
What if my child has food allergies? You are responsible for bringing this to our attention.  During the checkout process you will have the opportunity to list this food allergy on your registration form.  Please consider the menu being created on class day and if you have any questions about the ingredients, please feel free to contact our learning center at 949-679-8390.

OCBG Off Flavor Course @ Gunwhale Ales.name: OCBG Off Flavor Course @ Gunwhale Ales
OCBG Off Flavor Course @ Gunwhale Ales.description:
The Orange County Brewers Guild is dedicated to the education and promotion of the great craft beer movement happening in our county. Developing sensory analysis skills allows attendees to become familiar with common off beer flavors; an important key to understanding craft beer, its quality and importance of proper storage & handling. This course walks you through some basic off-flavors that can occur. At each class, seven different common off flavors will be tasted and discussed. This course lasts approximately 1.5 hours.
Off flavors presented will be: Acetaldehyde, D.M.S., Isoamyl, Contamination, Diacetyl, Papery, Light Struck
Do

Be fragrance neutral
Participate regularly
Take sensory evaluation seriously
Take time and focus on the evaluation
Follow methods and instructions precisely
Rest and cleanse your palate

Don’t

Eat, drink or smoke 30 minutes before the evaluation session
Use gum or mints 30 minutes before the evaluation session
Wear perfume, cologne or fragrance


NOTE: Attendees must be 21+. This seminar is non-transferable and non-refundable. Pre-registration is required.

Thursday, Lil' Chef Cooking Class - Ages.description:
This is a class for children 5 years of age and older.  Starting Jan 2018, we also offer classes Wednesdays 4:00 pm - 5:30 pm (Dec is sold out).
Give your child the gift of confidence and the joy of cooking! Our culinary program offers hands-on cooking lessons for budding young chefs. We learn more than how to follow a recipe at Lil' Chef School. We utilize math, science, teamwork, creativity and more.Children learn cuisines of the world and enhance their experience with fruits, vegetables, herbs & spices while gaining confidence and experience in the kitchen that will last them a lifetime. Children will make 2 recipes each week and will get a tasting of the food they made at the end of class.  Recipes are provided online.
These classes are open to children 5 years of age and older. Sign up for 12 weeks and receive 3 complimentary friend passes, a value of $120. Valid for first-time customers.

Electric City Butcher: Beef 102 Workshop.name: Electric City Butcher: Beef 102 Workshop
Electric City Butcher: Beef 102 Workshop.description:
Join us for another first at Electric City Butcher, our Beef 102 Forequarter Workshop. Our whole animal butchers will break down a forequarter, home of the ribeye steak, using the seam butchery technique. 
Because of the large, complex nature of beef butchery, this class is less hands-on than most of our 100 series courses, however, students will learn basic knife skills, practice roast-trussing, and take home some meat. As with all of our classes, each participant receives 10% off any in-store purchases, and a 10%-off coupon for their next visit.
To celebrate our evening of learning, refreshments are always served at the end of the night.
FAQs
 What's the refund policy?
Class registrations are non-refundable, but transferable to a different date or attendee. If you can’t make it, please let us know three days (72 hours) before the scheduled class by phone or email. For any late cancelations (after 72 hours) ECB will issue store credit in the amount of 50% of the registration fee. 
 What are my transportation/parking options for getting to and from the event?
Public parking is available in the Bush Avenue Parking Structure (at 4th Street) or by metered parking along 4th Street.  
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Feel free to contact us with any questions at askthebutcher@electriccitybutcher.com or (714) 474-9096.

Hands-on instruction in how to break down a whole Superior Farms Lamb.

Dec 1st, 2017 - Dice Game Bunco - South.name: Dec 1st, 2017 - Dice Game Bunco - South Orange County - Women 30's - 40's
Dec 1st, 2017 - Dice Game Bunco - South.description:
~ 12/1/17 is a Maybe Date. Only if we have 12-16 players sign up will this Bunco date proceed. So it is Tentative as of now. ~
The South Orange County Bunco group is comprised of ladies in their 30's - early 40's (although we have players in their early 50's who look younger that I do!) who are funny and awesome on the inside and out. (If you are anywhere near a wallflower, super quiet or always too shy to come out of your shell and really socialize with strangers, this group may not be for you. Bunco is a dice game and gamers who like wine and cocktails often have the most fun of all!)
For Buncos on the First Friday of Every Monthly:
1 - Bring $8 in cash (single $1 bills - if you please) that covers appetizers, table snacks, dinner, dessert, wine and cocktails. (Players usually Uber home around 11:00 because it's open bar. Just FYI.)
2 - For the Appearance Theme, is To Be Determined - the official invitation will state it. (An example is 'Breakfast at Tiffany’s' (dress, pearls, gloves, hat, sunglasses, etc.)
3 - The Gift Theme is To Be Determined - the official invitation will state it. (An example is 'everything that smells divine'.)
4 - This is important:  Buy the Bunco gift every month with cash - only - so that any returns exchanges to the store by the winner of your gift can be a breeze. So that means you can't buy a gift card and you can't buy anything on Amazon, etc. (We loathe store credit!) * We will check when you arrive that your receipt states that you paid with cash for the Bunco gift. *
5 - Bring the receipt for the $25 + gift in an envelope or bag with you to Bunco. (In case the winner prefers to return the Bunco prize later on.) Presenting the Bunco gift and the receipt together is mandatory.
6 - The Bunco gift each month must be a surprise. So bring the gift wrapped or in a gift bag or a garbage bag or anything opaque. The winner picks the Bunco gift out as a surprise.
7 - Bunco in General:
Every player that RSVP's YES gets a Punchbowl / Evite electronic invitation - because there's a lot of details for Bunco (if a person has never heard of it or played it.) So we have to send the invitation to all players electronically to make sure all players are on board with what to wear, what cash to bring and what to buy as their gift. Message a way for me to send that invitation to you electronically, if you RSVP that Yes you are definitely attending in the future.
8 - If you are new to Bunco and you want to bring a friend - that would be totally cool! Message me their info and they will be sent an invitation as well.
9 - Bunco attendance each month is first come, first served - because Bunco has a set number of players (12 or 16). The members of this group that RSVP first will be sent the Punchbowl / Evite invitation. After the player maximum is reached that are attending, then the women that RSVP on EventBrite will move to a stand-by list to play for that month.
10 - Stand-by is not bad at all! Players sometimes have to unavoidably cancel at the last minute, so we contact the stand-by list immediately and see who is still available to come play Bunco for that date.
11 - Hope you get a chance to come play Bunco sometime and meet all the funny hottie biscotti players!
** Contact the Coordinator of Bunco for this 12/1/17 event with your contact info so you can be sent the official monthly Bunco Punchbowl invitation that you also need to RSVP to in order to be confirmed for the Bunco event. **

We think the best relationships are forged when we are comfortable, relaxed and free of pressure. Preferring instead to think of the evening as a casual night out where one can truly be themselves. We do not use traditional 'speed dating' offerings such as bells, whistles and name-tags. Instead we focus on creating an atmosphere conducive to meeting others; a great venue, a personable host and a staff to assist.
~~~
Upon arriving at your chosen event - locate your event host. Your host will assist in setting you up with your scorecard for the evening. A simple and convenient way to keep track of whom you enjoyed meeting and those that you would like to see again. Should you have any questions - feel free to ask away. Take the time before the event starts to settle in - have a beverage if you would like and mingle should you wish. The speed dating portion of the event begins once all daters have arrived, checked in and had a moment or two to relax and unwind.
~~~
During the event, Ladies will stay seated and the Gentleman will rotate from table to table every 5 - 6 minutes. Our host will guide the Gentleman to let them know when their time is up and facilitate in seeing them to the next table. The goal is to find someone you would like to speak with further. Don't fret about figuring out if person is the one or the perfect person for you. Consider it the date before the date. Select those you would like to meet again and give the completed scorecard back to your host at the end of the evening. Our staff will tabulate the results and email you the following day with your results. If you choose someone and they chose you - it's a match. You will be given each others first name and email address. The rest is up to you.

MyCheekyDate Speed Dating Event - OC Sin.name: MyCheekyDate Speed Dating Event - OC Singles
MyCheekyDate Speed Dating Event - OC Sin.description:
Sophisticated Simplicity
Our events offer a fresh alternative to speed dating and matchmaking. We don't find anything romantic about whistles, name-tags or over-the-top party trimmings typically found at singles events so we have done away with them. Creating an atmosphere that is at once casual and comfortable. It's what we call cheeky-chic!
Our personable hosts will assist you with your MyCheekyDate 'Date-Mate' Scorecard. Flirty and fun, your Scorecard is just the beginning. Chat up our Hosts for tips or simply to ask, which direction the bar is in! After being shown to your table, the ladies will remain seated for the duration of the event. The gents move from lovely lady to lovely lady every six to seven minutes. Simply jot down your potential 'Date-Mates' at the bottom of your Scorecard and we'll take care of the rest. For those who garner matches, you will be notified via e-mail within 24 hours of the event ending of your 'Date-Mate' results. Alas, the event is over but the night has just begun. Feel free to stay as long as you would like to mingle further. All we need are the 'Date-Mate' Scorecards to determine if love is in the air for you.
Offering uncompromising value with unparalleled service. Lovely venues and our lovely Hosts to assist you with anything or anyone.
Speed Dating @ Mesa - February 6th 2017
Ages: 24-38 | 8PM
725 Baker St. Costa Mesa, CA 92626


http://www.mycheekydate.com

37th Annual UVSA Tet Festival - Lunar Ne.name: 37th Annual UVSA Tet Festival - Lunar New Year Celebration
37th Annual UVSA Tet Festival - Lunar Ne.description: Tet is the most observed holiday in Vietnamese culture. It celebrates the Lunar New Year, the beginning of Spring, and a fresh start.    Hosted by the Union of Vietnamese Student Associations of Southern California, the UVSA Tet Festival (Hoi Tet Sinh Vien) is recognized as the world's largest Vietnamese Lunar New Year celebration outside of Vietnam. The festival attracts over 50,000 guests annually and includes hundreds of booths during a three-day weekend event. Visitors are immersed in a vibrant array of traditional foods, live entertainment, cultural displays, and festive games, as well as a spectacular firecrackers show to celebrate the new year. Located in the heart of Orange County and just a short drive from Los Angeles or San Diego, the UVSA Tet Festival is the best way to spend the Lunar New Year holiday weekend in Southern California.

Santa Ana Industrial Arts Roundtable.name: Santa Ana Industrial Arts Roundtable
Santa Ana Industrial Arts Roundtable.description:
Join Santa Ana artists, arts organizations, creatives and arts educators for an evening exploring Santa Ana as a a haven for industrial artists -- those who design and build things.
The Heritage Museum of Orange County is opening their unique gardens and patio for a showcase of Santa Ana's diverse industrials arts talent -- spanning from blacksmiths to brewmasters, car designers to material artists.
If you're involved or interested in the arts, don't miss this opportunity to get connected and learn more about an eclectic mix of working industrial artists in our city. Industrial artists interested in presenting or hosting a booth at the Arts Roundtable are encouraged to contact Madeleine Spencer at mspencer@sabcinc.com.
This free, outdoor event starts with an exciting plenary talk and panel discussion, followed by a reception and exploration of industry booths, culiminating in presentations by participating industrial artists to their peers, local government, media, education partners and interested attendees who RSVP online.

EVENT SCHEDULE
3 pm - Registration Opens
4 pm - Plenary Speaker
4:30 pm - Panel Discussion
5:30 pm - Reception & “Walk of Industry”
7 pm - Presentations
8 pm - Closing

ABOUT THE ARTS ROUNDTABLE SERIES
This event is part of a multi-event series, the Santa Ana Arts Roundtable events organized by Santa Ana’s downtown improvement district, with the hopes to connect and empower artists in-person and online at SantaAnaArts.org.

Los Angeles BKS Festival - September 201.description:

Galentine's Day Party.name: Galentine's Day Party
Galentine's Day Party.description:
Lifestyle blogger, Karissa Raya of Olive la Vida is passionate about friendship and celebrating womanhood.  For the last 5 years she has planned Galentine's day for her own friends and hosted in her home, but this year, she welcomes all womyn to join in for an afternoon of networking, tarot card reading, crafting and mimosas.   There will be a raffle on the day of the event and all proceeds from the raffle ticket sales will be donated to Global G.L.O.W.  
Follow Karissa @olivelavida and @chingonaclinics on Instagram as more details flow in and for behind the scenes looks into the planning process!  Event is 21+ (mommas welcome to bring infants). 
What is Galentine's Day? 
"Oh it's only the best day of the year. Every February 13th, my lady friends and I leave our husbands and our boyfriends at home, and we just come and kick it, breakfast-style. Ladies celebrating ladies. It's like Lilith Fair, minus the angst. Plus frittatas." —Leslie Knope (Parks and Rec)
Tunes: Allierockk 
Mimosa Bar:  OneHope wine
DIY activites: Crystal Domi, Aceite Mama 
Shake Sample Bar: The Wanderful Team 
Essential Oil education: Salvage Life
Custom Portraits: GrumpGrl Sam
Florals: the2figs
Thank you to our very generous raffle donors: 
Yoga Squared 
Pepper's Boudoir Photography 
Daisy Chains

MainPlace Mall Hosts 2018 Lunar New Year.name: MainPlace Mall Hosts 2018 Lunar New Year Festival!
MainPlace Mall Hosts 2018 Lunar New Year.description: It’s the year of the dog, and MainPlace Mall is celebrating with a HUGE Lunar New Year Festival on Saturday, February 3 from Noon to 3pm! Free to attend, the entire community is invited to join in the exciting celebration filled with cultural entertainment and fun activities that the whole family will love! We’ve partnered with the Union of Vietnamese Student Associations (UVSA) to bring you stunning visuals and colorful performances as we honor the very special Lunar New Year traditions together! Festival details include:* Live Entertainment: Stilt walkers, Fan dancers, Lion dance and Beautiful cultural performances* Fun Children’s Activities: Face painters and balloon twisters, Calligraphy artists and Arts and crafts * Gorgeous “Instagram-worthy” Décor!* “Wishing Tree”: Make a wish for someone special for a chance to win THEM a prize to show how much you care. Prizes will include merchandise and gift cards to MainPlace retailers!* Gift with Purchase: Shoppers who present a $50+ purchase receipt made at any MainPlace Mall retailer will receive a free plush dog. Purchase must be made on Feb. 3, 2018 by 2:30 pm; while supplies last.* Tet Festival tickets: USVA will be giving out free tickets for children to attend the upcoming Tet Festival taking place on Feb. 16-18 at the OC Fair & Events Center (while supplies last).

Resilience Rising: Defend the Sacred, Se.name: Resilience Rising: Defend the Sacred, Second Annual Gala
Resilience Rising: Defend the Sacred, Se.description:
Donations can be made here.
Our gala is inspired and informed by the current movements that are defending and uplifting what is sacred: land, water, community and voices.
 
“We know what we need for our communities.”
 
We are honored to invite you to join Resilience Orange County for our 2nd Annual Gala – Resilience Rising: Defend the Sacred!
 
Our annual dinner will take place on Thursday, February 8th at the Taqueria de Anda Banquet Hall. The dinner is an opportunity for our community and supporters to celebrate the accomplishments that we have collectively won through People Power! This also serves as an important opportunity to solidify our collective efforts to insure that we invest in youth, organize to bring equity for immigrant communities and communities of color, ensure that we are creating spaces for girls and womxn of color, bring transparency and accountability to systems, combat displacement, and bridge movements!

Let's honor the work that community leaders have had this past year!
Our Community Warrior honorees are:
 for Transforming Systems: Project Kinship


















for Community Justice: Western State Immigration Clinic















for Transformative Youth Leadership: Santa Ana Unidos
 














for Community Resilience: The Aguirre Family
 














for Community Courage: The Reyes Family








Join us in celebrating our accomplishments:

Successfully passed the Santa Ana Sanctuary City Ordinance, one of the strongest in the nation.
Advocated for over $165,000 in immigrant defense in Santa Ana, the first such fund in Orange County.
Advocated for first ever Youth Coordinator position in the city of Santa Ana.
Pre registered over 1,000 high school youth to vote.
Have provided technical immigration support to Garden Grove, Santa Ana, and Laguna Beach school districts.
Mobilized over 1,000 people to bring attention to the School to Prison to Deportation Pipeline.
Graduated a cohort of youth in our People Power curriculum.
Graduated a cohort of Youth Justice Fellows.
Successfully launched the first Girls and Womxn of Color initiative in the county.

OC LGBTQ Youth Convening 2018.name: OC LGBTQ Youth Convening 2018
OC LGBTQ Youth Convening 2018.description:
The OC LGBTQ Youth Convening is a FREE day-long conference organized for LGBTQIA youth and their allies. This event is organized by YETA (Youth Empowered to Act) at The LGBT Center OC. 
 
Join us for our 5th Annual OC LGBTQ Youth Convening to empower yourself and your community! We will have an array of speakers, presenters, and organizations working to create safe, supportive and inclusive spaces for Orange County lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and questioning youth.

Topics include: LGBTQ Student Rights, Art and Identity, Coming Out, Transgender Awareness and Activism, Parent Support, Mental Health and much more!
This is a free event for youth, students, parents, teachers, school administrators, and local community members.

Questions, Contact: Tony Ortuño
tony.ortuno@lgbtcenteroc.org
714-953-5428 ext. 209

Training for Facilitators (T4F).name: Training for Facilitators (T4F)
Training for Facilitators (T4F).description:
The Training for Facilitators (T4F) workshop is reserved for those who expect to be active volunteer facilitators in community &/or prison workshops.This workshop focuses on developing team building, leadership methods, and group process skills. You will work in a small group, actually functioning as a facilitator. You will receive guidance and practice in facilitating all parts of a Basic Workshop:* Team Building & Team Contract* Agendas * Exercises, brainstorms, and discussions* Transforming Power Talk * Light & Livelies * Role PlaysAs the last step in the training, you will apprentice with workshop leadership teams in other Mini, Basic or Advanced AVP Workshops. 
PREREQUISITE: Completion of Basic and Advanced Workshops.COST: We ask for a donation of $50-150 to cover workshop-related expenses and to support our work in both the community and in prisons. PLEASE PAY WHAT YOU CAN. However, no one will be turned away due to lack of funds.

February Divisions F and G Councils Meet.description: February is Club Speech Contest Month, it's DCP planning month, Pathways has rolled out.

Gary Goes Global: Orange, CA.name: Gary Goes Global: Orange, CA
Gary Goes Global: Orange, CA.description:
Gary Goes Global!
Join Semester at Sea to welcome and celebrate our new President and CEO, Dr. Gary Ransdell. In his first year, Dr. Ransdell is eager to meet many Semester at Sea alumni, friends, parents, former faculty and staff, and Lifelong Learners.
Please join us on Wednesday, February 28 from 6:00-8:00 PM at the Hilbert Museum of California Art, an extension of Chapman University. We invite you to learn more about Dr. Ransdell’s vision for Semester at Sea, share your own experiences with our program, and connect with other passionate global travelers. Tickets cost $25 and include hors d'oeuvres and refreshments.
Questions? Email alumni@semesteratsea.org or visit semesteratsea.org/garygoesglobal.com for more information.

Old Town Irvine Walking Tour.name: Old Town Irvine Walking Tour
Old Town Irvine Walking Tour.description: Step back in time to explore the rich history of Irvine and the Irvine family. This docent-led walking tour reveals what life was like in Irvine in the early 1900s with site tours of what was once the bean granary, boarding house, blacksmith shop and more. Meet in the La Quinta Inn lobby. Tour will be converted to indoor lecture at La Quinta Inn in the event of rain.

Trans* Lives & Rights: Contemporary Lega.name: Trans* Lives & Rights: Contemporary Legal & Policy Battles
Trans* Lives & Rights: Contemporary Lega.description:
Transgender rights are among the most controversial political topics in the United States. Legislative and regulatory policy decisions in different parts of the country have led to wildly disparate results: North Carolina’s HB2, federal guidelines on the use of bathrooms in schools, and California’s Gender Recognition Bill are prime examples. A large swath of this country aims to restrict transgender rights. Other states are increasing legal services and protections, and have made affirmative policy decisions to protect transgender individuals.
Outlaw is hosting a collaborative symposium, bringing together a diverse and respected group of academics, community activists, politicians, and community members to address both theoretical and practical concerns and considerations surrounding transgender rights, and the rights of non-binary and gender non-conforming individuals. Symposium sessions will cover a variety of topics, including defining gender, the inclusive or exclusive nature of feminism, immigration, policing, local legal actions, and national policy fights. The symposium will educate UCI Law students and community members about transgender rights and encourage discussion about discrimination against transgender individuals in Orange County and other parts of the nation.
Additional information regarding confirmed speakers and finalized topics will appear on this website as the symposium date nears.
To request reasonable accommodations for a disability, please contact UC Irvine School of Law at (949) 824-0066.

2nd Annual Making Herstory Event.name: 2nd Annual Making Herstory Event
2nd Annual Making Herstory Event.description:
2nd Annual Making Herstory Event
In honor of Women's History Month, the Women's Journey Foundation is hosting an event to recognize and honor the contributions of women in history and women of today.
The Women's Journey Foundation will host a dinner, awards ceremony, musical entertainment, fashion show of the ages and a talk show featuring women in US History. This event is designed to educate, entertain and engage attendees of all ages.
Who: for women, girls and men who support them
When: Saturday, March 10, 2018 5:00 to 8:00 pm
Where: Women's Journey Foundation 3400 Michelson Dr, Irvine CA 92612
Proceeds fund the Women's Journey Foundation and it's ongoing free self-esteem workshops for at-risk girls.

Laguna Beach Free Walking Tour.name: Laguna Beach Free Walking Tour
Laguna Beach Free Walking Tour.description:
The only "pay what you feel" guided tour. If you’re looking to find out about the history of Laguna Beach or just want a leisurely walk through this art colony, then ours is the tour for you. The 1.5 mile, two hour stroll through the heart of Laguna Beach will take you back in time and bring you up to date on this beautiful coastal community. Our tour begins in front of the Pageant of the Masters / Festival of the Arts and weaves it’s way south towards the eucalyptus tree lined Forest Avenue.  We’ll head further south towards the White House and Peppertree Lane before crossing Pacific Coast Highway and heading north towards the unprecedented gift of Brown’s Park. Continuing on past Greeter’s Corner and Main Beach, we’ll finish our tour after a few interesting stops in Heisler Park with a picturesque view of the ocean and possibly, if the sky is clear, a panorama of the elusive Catalina Island.
Please sign up at least 24 hours in advance and meet us in front of the Pageant of the Masters and fall in love with Laguna Beach!

Costa Mesa Family Resource Center Food D.name: Costa Mesa Family Resource Center Food Distributions Signup
Costa Mesa Family Resource Center Food D.description:
As a collaboration with the Second Harvest Food Bank, The Raise Foundation provides food distribution opportunities to families-in-need throughout Orange County. Starting summer 2016, The Raise Foundation, in collaboration with Boys & Girls Club of Anaheim, began offering Food Distributions at the Club's newly renovated Clubhouse located at the Manzanita Community Park. The distributions, which are provided as part of The Raise Foundation's Resources in Motion Program (RIM), will take place on the 4th Saturday of the month and have so far served over 100 families. In addition, The Raise Foundation, in collaboration with Hoag Hospital, offers Food Distributions at the Costa Mesa Family Resource Center on the 1st Saturday of the month. 
A special thank you goes out to the Junior League of Orange County, Roosters Club members and the many other community volunteers for their volunteer assistance with past distributions.
More volunteers are needed to help for future Food Distributions with preparing bags of healthy food and leading children in fun craft activities. It has been shown that one of the many risk factors that can lead to child abuse and neglect is when families dont have the right nutrition or enough food to sustain them. Your help provides families in need with this critical support. 
Due the limited space, we ask that all interested volunteers register using this form.
First Time Volunteering?
If you are a first-time volunteer for The Raise Foundation Food Distribution, please contact The Raise Foundation to arrange for a brief in-person or over-the-phone interview.
Additional Volunteer Opportunities
Manzanita Park
Typically on the 4th Saturday of the month. Click here to learn more
South Orange County Family Resource Center
Typically on the 4th Thursday of the month. Click here to learn more
Mendocino at Talega
Typically on the 1st Saturday of the month. Click here to learn more

Understanding Community Choice Energy an.name: Understanding Community Choice Energy and its Opportunities
Understanding Community Choice Energy an.description:
The conference is organized and presented by OC Clean Power, a non-partisan alliance of stakeholder groups advocating for clean energy in Orange County. 
The goals of the conference are:1) To introduce and thoroughly explain Community Choice Energy (CCE) to city staff, elected officials, and the public2) To explain CCE’s potential benefits to residents, businesses, and city governments throughout Orange County.
*Keynote speaker: Kevin de Leon, President pro Tem, California State Senate (confirmed)
Industry experts working with CCEs throughout California will present on:

CCE study, start up, and operation
Fundamentals of wholesale and retail energy purchase and delivery
Industry updates
Additional opportunities and benefits CCEs can offer to consumers
How Orange County cities can get started down the CCE path

Panelists include:

Howard Choy, moderator
EES Consulting
The Energy Coalition
ICF
Vanir Sustainability
The Energy Authority
Constellation Power
Kit Cole Consulting
Calpine

 FAQs
Do I have to register to attend? How much are tickets?
Registration is required, as space is limited. Registration is free.
 Where do I park?
Parking is available across the street in the Student Center parking structure and free with validation.
Will food be served?
Free registration includes a vegan lunch. A happy hour will follow the conference at 3:00pm.

The Hamlet Trial.name: The Hamlet Trial
The Hamlet Trial.description: Please join us for the 2017-18 Kirk Davis Jr. Public Shakespeare Lecture!!Was Hamlet insane when he killed Polonius and sent Rosencrantz and Guildenstern to their deaths, or did he retain enough moral sense to be held accountable for their demise?Hamlet’s lawyer, Song Richardson (Dean, UCI School of Law), will argue the insanity defense, based on his delusions and depression. The prosecutor, Erwin Chemerinsky (Dean, Berkeley Law), will argue that the prince was merely pretending to be mad. The Honorable Andrew Guilford, District Judge, will bring order to the courtroom for this literary and legal adventure.Who is right? You’ll be part of the jury! Audience members will vote on the outcome.Directed by Eli SimonProduced by Julia LuptonSponsored by UCI Illuminations, UCI Shakespeare Center, the UCI School of Law, the Department of English, and the Department of Drama, with the generous support of Kirk Davis Jr.

Author Alice Sebold '98, \"Lucky\" and \.name: Author Alice Sebold '98, "Lucky" and "The Lovely Bones"
Author Alice Sebold '98, \"Lucky\" and \.description:
Author Alice Sebold '98, Lucky and The Lovely Bones
Public reading with Q&A 5:00-6:00 p.m:  (Book Signing Following Event at 6:00PM)

Rarely has an author had such an impact on international literature with her first novel, especially when it focuses on the dark subjects of rape, child murder, and the dissolution of families. Yet with The Lovely Bones, Alice Sebold seemed to manage the impossible.
“My name was Salmon, like the fish; first name, Susie. I was 14 when I was murdered on December 6, 1973.” So begins The Lovely Bones, one of the best-reviewed novels of the decade. The book quickly became an unprecedented international bestseller, with translations in over 45 languages and American sales alone of over five million copies. A film version of The Lovely Bones (Fall 2009) was adapted, written and directed by Peter Jackson. Three months after the publication of The Lovely Bones, Sebold’s 1999 memoir Lucky, an account of her rape at the age of 18 and the trial that followed, also rose to number one on The New York Times bestseller list. Lucky is being reissued by Scribner, with a new forward by the author, in 2017.  
2007 saw publication of The Almost Moon, Sebold's controversial second novel, which began with yet another gripping first sentence: "When all was said and done, killing my mother came easily." Another #1 bestseller, The Almost Moon generated more critical discord -- both laudatory and negative -- than any other novel in memory as Sebold plunged into taboo territories of matricide, mental illness and profound ambivalence about mother/daughter relationships.
Born in Madison, Wisconsin, Sebold grew up in the suburbs of Philadelphia and attended Syracuse University as well as the University of Houston and UC Irvine. She has contributed to numerous anthologies and edited The Best American Short Stories 2009. She selected and edited the first four published books with Tonga Books, a Europa Editions imprint specializing in works of literary fiction by American authors.

Rio Is Here Dance Festival.name: Rio Is Here Dance Festival
Rio Is Here Dance Festival.description:
The Rio Is Here Dance Festival features 10 hours of leveled workshops and socials on both Friday and Saturday nights! We'll be welcoming back for the third year in a row, Renata Peçanha, the co-creator of zouk, and for the first time ever in California, FREDDY & ANDRESSA! 
Location: Workshops and Saturday social will be held at the beautiful and spacious Avant Guard Ballroom!Address:1502 E Warner AveSanta Ana, CA. 92705

Weekend schedule:4 HOURS OF WORKSHOPS WITH RENATA!4 HOURS OF WORKSHOPS WITH FREDDY & ANDRESSA!
Friday Social - 9:30 PM - UNTIL YOU DROP AMSaturday Workshops 12-5:30 PMSaturday Dance Party: 9:30 PM- UNTIL YOU DROP AMSunday Workshops 12-5:30 PM
**Limited Early Bird Passes only $99! Included with the early bird pass are workshops and socials!
Participating;★ Renata Peçanha★ Freddy & Andressa★ Clinton & Cristi
Local Team:★JC Arazga & Devon-Near Hill★Marissa & Rinaldo
If you are interested in booking private classes with Renata Peçanha, Freddy & Andressa, Clinton Lacerda or Cristi Boone, please notify Clinton Lacerda immediately via PM, as their schedules were TOTALLY BOOKED UP last year and they had to turn people away! 
There are many hotels nearby, the cheapest option is Clarion Inn and Suites, which offers us a discounted group rate of $95 per night (mention Rio Is Here Dance Festival) and the most elegant is Embassy Suites which has a beautiful garden area. Both are located within walking distance from the venue. 
*Hotel not included in event price.
About Renata Peçanha
Renata Peçanha is world renowned dance professional. Her academy was founded in 2000, of which she is the principle dancer, choreographer and director. It has become one of the most reputable and well known dança de salão academies in Rio de Janeiro and world-wide.
Dubbed the “Queen of Brazilian Zouk”, Renata is the most well known female Brazilian Zouk dancer in Brazil and needless to say, her academy specializes in Brazilian Zouk. Renata worked with Jaime Arôxa’s Company for 6 years, Brazil’s premier dance academy. She is a highly sought after instructor at Zouk congresses throughout Brazil and Europe, such as the International Congress of Brazilian Zouk in Porto Seguro and Zouk Lovers in Holland. As well as organizing Zouk Lambada events such as Zouk’n Rio, and the International Congress of Brazilian Zouk in Rio de Janeiro, Renata has choreographed and danced for many reputable television shows and soap operas in Brazil.

The How, The Why: Jonathan Lethem.name: The How, The Why: Jonathan Lethem
The How, The Why: Jonathan Lethem.description:
A live recording of our educational podcast The How, The Why with Jonathan Lethem.
Jonathan Lethem is the author of ten novels, including The Fortress of Solitude, Girl In Landscape, and A Gambler’s Anatomy. His fifth, Motherless Brooklyn, won The National Book Critic’s Circle Award. In 2005 he was named a Fellow of the Macarthur Foundation. His stories and essays have been collected in five volumes and his writing has been translated into over thirty languages. He’s the Roy E. Disney ’51 Chair in Creative Writing at Pomona College, and lives in Claremont and Maine.
Photo: Adrian Cook
 

 

The How The Why is a half-hour podcast documenting the creative process and the creative purpose hosted by Jon-Barrett Ingels. This free weekly series is an educational resource provided to discuss the evolution of literary arts with industry innovators. Interviews are structured as friendly conversations and conducted via telephone. Occasionally, episodes will be recorded live at special events and highlight multiple guests.

Writers\u2019 Block Live: Nan Cohen And.name: Writers’ Block Live: Nan Cohen And Victoria Chang
Writers\u2019 Block Live: Nan Cohen And.description:
Writers’ Block Live! with Nan Cohen and Victoria Chang. This reading series aims to highlight and discuss writers across various genres and fields.
Nan Cohen, the longtime poetry director of the Napa Valley Writers’ Conference, is the author of two poetry collections, Rope Bridge (2005) and Unfinished City(2017).  Her work has appeared in magazines and anthologies including Ploughshares, Poet Lore, Poetry International, The New Republic and Slate.  The recipient of a Wallace Stegner Fellowship, a Rona Jaffe Writer’s Award, and a Literature Fellowship from the National Endowment for the Arts, she lives in Los Angeles and teaches at Viewpoint School and the UCLA Extension Writers’ Program.
Victoria Chang’s fourth book of poems, Barbie Chang, was published in 2017 by Copper Canyon Press.  The Boss (McSweeney’s) won the PEN Center USA Literary Award and a California Book Award.  Other books are Salvinia Molesta and Circle.  Her poems have been published in places such as Best American Poetry, American Poetry Review, New England Review, Poetry, The Nation, etc.  She was awarded a Guggenheim Fellowship in 2017.  Her picture book, Is Mommy? (Simon & Schuster), illustrated by Marla Frazee was named a New York Times Notable Book.  She teaches at Chapman University and Orange County School of the Arts.
 

 
Writers’ Block is a bi-weekly podcast that highlights the work of writers, poets, scientists, musicians, and more to find the story behind the pieces. Host Mike Gravagno digs into his guests work the same way he digs into pie, voraciously and without pretension, because you don’t have to be high-falutin to enjoy talking about art. Writers’ Block is a joint venture from YourPopFilter.com and Anastamos, Chapman University’s Interdisciplinary Graduate Journal, and is available wherever you get your podcasts.

The Sounds The Stories: Krista Marina.name: The Sounds The Stories: Krista Marina
The Sounds The Stories: Krista Marina.description:
A live recording of our educational podcast The Sounds The Stories with Krista Marina.
Krista Marina is an alternative pop singer/songwriter whose music displays jazz, blues, and sometimes folk, influences. Her interest in songwriting sparked from the various music genres she explored growing up. Although artists like Amy Winehouse, Alicia Keys and Hozier inspire her, Krista has a niche style that is evident in her music.
Raised in a cultural household, Krista developed an ear for dynamic vocals and appealing melodies. As soon as she discovered songwriting, Krista began taking music more seriously. At age 14, she joined a band with close friends with whom she fostered her art and performed countless gigs for five years. Lead singer, keyboardist, and cajon player of the group, Krista performed at notable venues, such as the Troubadour and the Viper Room. Meanwhile, at Huntington Beach High School, Krista was a part of the Music Media Entertainment Technology program of the Academy for the Performing Arts (APA MMET) through which she cultivated her songwriting and performing skills, and discovered her interest in production.
In June of 2016, Krista released her debut EP, “Bittersweet,” which she wrote and co-produced. The following November, she collaborated with producer Arc North to create “Meant To Be,” a single she both sang and co-wrote. Krista continues to write for herself and other artists, lend her voice to collaborations, play shows, and immerse herself in various pockets of music. Although Krista’s music stretches across genres, there is a certain intangible element about it that signifies a Krista Marina-type style that sets her apart from the rest.
 

 
The Sounds The Stories is an eclectic music series featuring live performances and entertaining discussions with emerging and established artists. This program is filmed and edited into a short documentary compilation with the audio from each episode recorded and archived as a free educational podcast. Produced in collaboration with our partners at Brew Sessions Live.

The How, The Why: Gabriel Gale And Ages.name: The How, The Why: Gabriel Gale And Ages Of Oz
The How, The Why: Gabriel Gale And Ages.description:
A live recording of our educational podcast The How The Why with Gabriel Gale and Ages of Oz. Produced in collaboration with Orange Home Grown and Tiddlywinks.
Gabriel Gale is a Brooklyn, NY native and  the creator of Ages of Oz, which he started approximately 10 years ago, after graduating with a Bachelor’s in Fine Art from Cooper Union and a Master’s in Architecture from Columbia. He has worked with Writer’s House, Scholastic, Simon & Schuster, William Morris Endeavor, Warner Bros, and A-list Hollywood Producers and Directors.
“Ages of Oz is a new adaption and expansion of the Oz that we all know and love. What sets us apart is that after deconstructing and rebuilding all of the characters, objects, and settings from L Frank Baum’s original 14 Oz books – only one of which was “The Wizard of Oz” – we created 1000 years of Oz history all the while staying true to Baum’s intentions… including that Glinda had fiery red hair!
We’ve launched Ages of Oz with a middle grade fiction book trilogy published by Simon & Schuster which tells the story of how Glinda goes from being a 13-year old student uncertain of her future to becoming the most powerful magician in all of Oz. The first book in the series is A Fiery Friendship, which was released May 16th, 2017. The second book is called A Dark Descent, targeted for release May 2018. Overall, this series tackles  social justice themes such as equality, unity, and thinking for yourself during a tumultuous political climate in which illusion, fear, terror, distraction, and unlawful imprisonment rule.”
 

 

The How The Why is a half-hour podcast documenting the creative process and the creative purpose hosted by Jon-Barrett Ingels. This free weekly series is an educational resource provided to discuss the evolution of literary arts with industry innovators. Interviews are structured as friendly conversations and conducted via telephone. Occasionally, episodes will be recorded live at special events and highlight multiple guests.

The How, The Why: Lucille Lang Day And D.name: The How, The Why: Lucille Lang Day And Dave Holt
The How, The Why: Lucille Lang Day And D.description:
A live recording of our educational podcast The How The Why with Lucille Lang Day and Dave Holt.
Lucille Lang Day is a co-editor of the anthology Red Indian Road West: Native American Poetry from California, which has received awards from PEN Oakland and Artists Embassy International. She has published ten poetry collections and chapbooks, including Becoming an Ancestor and Dreaming of Sunflowers: Museum Poems, which received the 2014 Blue Light Poetry Award. She is also the author of a two children’s books, Chain Letter and The Rainbow Zoo, and a memoir, Married at Fourteen, which received a PEN Oakland Josephine Miles Literary Award and was a finalist for the Northern California Book Award in Creative Nonfiction. Her poems, short stories, and essays have appeared widely in literary magazines and anthologies. The founder and director of Scarlet Tanager Books, she holds an MFA in creative writing from San Francisco State University and a PhD in science/mathematics education from the University of California, Berkeley. She is of Wampanoag, British, and Swiss/German descent.
After high school, Dave Holt began setting his poems to music. His desire to be a composer led to a move to California to get his songs published, but he ended up in San Francisco State University’s Creative Writing Program (BA ’93, MA ’95). His poetry has been published in several journals and has won prizes in the Thomas Merton’s Poetry of the Sacred, Maggie Meyer Memorial, Dancing Poetry, and  Ina Coolbrith contests. His essay “American Indian Poets and the Mixed-Blood Experience” appeared in Raven Chronicles. His book, Voyages to Ancestral Islands, which tells the story of reuniting with his Anishinaabe Ojibwe ancestors, won a Literary/Cultural Arts Award from Artists Embassy International (San Francisco). His work has been included in three anthologies, including Red Indian Road West and Descansos, Words from the Wayside, where his contributed poem received a Pushcart Prize nomination.
 

 

The How The Why is a half-hour podcast documenting the creative process and the creative purpose hosted by Jon-Barrett Ingels. This free weekly series is an educational resource provided to discuss the evolution of literary arts with industry innovators. Interviews are structured as friendly conversations and conducted via telephone. Occasionally, episodes will be recorded live at special events and highlight multiple guests.

The How, The Why: Kevin Staniec.name: The How, The Why: Kevin Staniec
The How, The Why: Kevin Staniec.description:
A live recording of our educational podcast The How, The Why with Kevin Staniec. This event celebrates the release of his new novella And Then, This.
And Then, This threads instability seamlessly throughout the novella, leaving the reader questioning the truth at every turn. From the first apocalyptic images of a burning Southern California to Riley’s surreal journey along the coast, Kevin Staniec surpasses the traditional questions of a murder mystery and asks, “what if?”
Kevin Staniec is an arts advocate, author, publisher, and the founder of 1888, a regional catalyst for the preservation, presentation, and promotion of cultural heritage and literary arts. He has published over 80 books, his exhibitions viewed by more than a half-million people, and his work featured in numerous global media outlets.
Kevin is the recipient of the Arts Leader Award presented by Arts Orange County and recognized as one of Orange County’s most influential and innovative entrepreneurs in Modern Luxury Magazine, OC Weekly, and the Orange County Register.
Kevin studied Creative Writing and Film & Media Arts at Chapman University. He is the author of I Am. You Are., Begin, 29 to 31: A Book of Dreams, And Then, This, the Treehouse Bandits collection of children’s stories, and Mojave, co-written with author Ryan Gattis.

 

 


The How The Why is a half-hour podcast documenting the creative process and the creative purpose hosted by Jon-Barrett Ingels. This free weekly series is an educational resource provided to discuss the evolution of literary arts with industry innovators. Interviews are structured as friendly conversations and conducted via telephone. Occasionally, episodes will be recorded live at special events and highlight multiple guests.

The How, The Why: Amy Wallen And Samanth.name: The How, The Why: Amy Wallen And Samantha Dunn
The How, The Why: Amy Wallen And Samanth.description:
A live recording of our educational podcast The How, The Why with Amy Wallen and guest moderator Samantha Dunn.
Amy E. Wallen is Associate Director at the New York State Writers Institute and teaches creative writing at the University of California, San Diego Extension. Her first novel, Moon Pies and Movie Stars, was a Los Angeles Times bestseller. When We Were Ghouls, releases in Spring 2018. Her essays have been published in The Gettysburg Review, The Normal School, Country Living and other national magazines and anthologies.
Samantha Dunn is an editor at Coast Magazine. Her debut novel, Failing Paris, was a finalist for the PEN Center Fiction Award. Her memoir, Not By Accident: Reconstructing a Careless Life rose to bestseller lists in Los Angeles and San Francisco and her second memoir, Faith in Carlos Gomez, has been in production at  Lifetime Television. Sam’s work is widely anthologized, including the short story collection, Women on the Edge: Writing from Los Angeles, which she co-edited. Her essays have appeared in numerous national publications such as O (Oprah) Magazine, Ms., and Salon. She teaches in the UCLA Extension Writers Program and at the Idyllwild Arts Academy.
 

 

The How The Why is a half-hour podcast documenting the creative process and the creative purpose hosted by Jon-Barrett Ingels. This free weekly series is an educational resource provided to discuss the evolution of literary arts with industry innovators. Interviews are structured as friendly conversations and conducted via telephone. Occasionally, episodes will be recorded live at special events and highlight multiple guests.

Wine Tasting for a Song.description:
Our Winetasting for a Song event will be the most enjoyable fundraising event you will attend this year. Join the de Angelis board of directors for an early evening of delicious appetizers and premium wines and help support the de Angelis ensemble. Our host for the afternoon this year is the Winery Restaurant, centrally located in Tustin.
Share a glass of wine, sample delicious bites, and bid on unique vintages of wines at this beautiful Orange County location.

Craft & Arts - Chapman Crafted Beer.name: Craft & Arts - Chapman Crafted Beer
Craft & Arts - Chapman Crafted Beer.description:
CRAFT (beer) & ARTS ('n' crafts)...
NOT YOUR AVERAGE PAINT NIGHT.
A ticket includes one craft beer which serves as the inspiration for a different artistic experience.  
Drink that beer and let its colors, scents, flavors, memories, and social conversation spark the creative process.   
With various examples of mixed media/collage type art pieces to choose from, we will each create a unique piece representing our beer and experience that night. There is still instruction, and there are still steps to help, and all the materials are provided, but the purpose is to learn and appreciate craft beer, mostly as an art form, and unlock the creative process in everyone.
If you are NOT "creative" and "artistic," cool!  If you are "creative" and "artistic," cool!  Craft Beer is largely about community, and so is Art...you in? 
@_craftandarts

INTENSIVE Pro Dance Workshop.description:

2018 MoGa Expo - The Mobile Gaming Conve.name: 2018 MoGa Expo - The Mobile Gaming Convention
2018 MoGa Expo - The Mobile Gaming Conve.description:
MoGa Expo is a mobile gaming convention designed by mobile gamers for mobile gamers. Enjoy custom tournament style events on some of your favorite mobile games or come for a meet and greet with your most adored YouTuber or Twitch streamer.
 We are a convention solely dedicated to the mobile gaming community unlike any other gaming convention in the nation. We provide a unique atmosphere that brings mobile gaming fanatics together in a competitive and entertaining environment. Attendees can expect to participate in multiple different events including:

Comprehensive tournaments for the hottest mobile games in the industry, culminating with a cash prize to the victors
Cosplay competitions to give the fans a chance to display their artistic side by dressing up as their favorite mobile game character
Meet and greets with your most adored celebrity YouTuber
Live musical performances
Browse through a diverse variety of vendors that contribute to the mobile gaming industry
First-look experience of next generation mobile games presented by the developers themselves
Additional exclusive services will be provided to our VIP guests

Event is FREE for pre-registered attendees. Attendees registered before April 1 will be entered into a giveaway for a FREE iPad Mini (30 winners will be chosen).
If you do not pre-register, it will be $20 at the door.

Full Event - Pre-Registration (Saturday & Sunday, August 11-12): FREE
Full Event - VIP Experience (Saturday & Sunday, August 11-12 - Limited Availability): $50

For more information visit www.mogaexpo.com.

3rd Annual Ground Zero Animation EXPO.name: 3rd Annual Ground Zero Animation EXPO
3rd Annual Ground Zero Animation EXPO.description:
More info on our website: 2018 3rd Annual Ground Zero Animation EXPO on our website!
Ground Zero Animation EXPO is an annual event held in Orange County, CA. This year it will be held at The Art Institute of Orange County, Santa Ana. The EXPO caters to those interested in breaking into the Animation industry or anyone who appreciates animated films, shows & shorts. The event also focuses on all parts of the industry from illustration, publishing, stop motion, fabricating and claymation/puppetry to character design, 3D modeling, prop/background design and much more. Industry professionals are there to share all day at their tables, through panels, demos, lectures, workshop and during unique one on one portfolio reviews. Ground Zero is a grassroots show that has a big impact. Don’t miss the exclusive special events leading up to the next Ground Zero Animation EXPO of 2018.

Violent Gentlemen Presents Miracle.description: The Winter Olympics are back and so is movie night with The Gents. Screening of \"70 Acres in Chicago: Cabr.name: Screening of "70 Acres in Chicago: Cabrini Green"
Screening of \"70 Acres in Chicago: Cabr.description:
Iluminations, The Chancellor's Arts and Culture Initiative, the Department of Urban Planning and Public Policy, and the Architecture and Urban Studies Research Cluster present a free public screening of the award winning documentary film 70 Acres in Chicago.
For 70 years, there stood a Chicago public housing community known as Cabrini Green. Home to thousands, misunderstood by millions, Cabrini Green once towered over Chicago’s most valuable neighborhoods. A looming reminder of inequality and poverty, Cabrini’s high-rises were demolished and an African-American community cleared to make room for another social experiment: mixed-income neighborhoods.Shot over the course of 20-years, 70 Acres in Chicago documents this upheaval, from the razing of the first buildings in 1995, to the clashes in the mixed-income neighborhoods a decade later. The film tells the volatile story of this hotly contested patch of land, while looking unflinchingly at race, class, and who has the right to live in the city.After the screening, a discussion of the film will take place with director Ronit Bezalel, Andrew Highsmith (History, UCI), Virginia Parks (Planning and Public Policy, UCI), and Rodolfo Torres (Planning and Public Policy, UCI).  
Reception to follow. Public parking is available in Mesa Parking Structure for $2/hour or $10/day.
If you have any questions, please contact Erica Yun, progran coordinator, at erica.yun@uci.edu

LUNAFEST: Orange, CA.name: LUNAFEST: Orange, CA
LUNAFEST: Orange, CA.description:
Zonta Club of Newport Harbor invites you to join us at 1:30 pm for a pre-screening VIP reception with delicious food and drink along with a Silent Auction, Opportunity Drawings, and Wine Pull. At 2:30 pm, a timely panel discussion with several of the women film directors will precede the screening of nine compelling short films by, for, and about women. All proceeds benefit women film students at Chapman University, advancing their careers in the male-dominated film industry. 
Early Bird Pricing is available through January 15th: $35 General Admission. Get your tickets early! General Admission goes up to $40 on January 16th.
About LUNAFEST
In 2000, LUNA Bar created LUNAFEST - a traveling film festival celebrating, showcasing and championing women in film. The festival is a fundraiser held by any host who wants to raise funds for a local women’s cause.  
Benefits: 
Women Students at the  Dodge College of Film & Media Arts at Chapman University

Wright Records & Acropolis Music Group P.description: Wright Records & Acropolis Music Group Presents:

Frida Cinema Volunteer Orientation: Febr.name: Frida Cinema Volunteer Orientation: February 2018
Frida Cinema Volunteer Orientation: Febr.description:
Join us for The Frida Cinema's second Volunteer Orientation of 2018!
Thank you for your interest in lending your valuable time and talents to The Frida Cinema - Orange County's only non-profit, independent art house cinema!  Please join us at our next Volunteer Orientation, to be held at The Frida Cinema on Sunday, February 11, 2018, from 1:30pm - 3pm.  Our monthly volunteer sessions provide our incoming volunteers with an opportunity to:


meet The Frida Cinema's Executive Director and Management Team


learn more about the roles of a Frida Cinema volunteer


learn about the specific shift dates and times that are currently available for Volunteers


learn about our goals and visions for the future as The Frida Cinema enters its fifth year


ask any questions you may have about your time with us!


Plus - we'll be feeding you!
If you would like to attend, please take a moment to RSVP to this event - having an accurate idea as to how many people will be joining us allows us to ensure we have enough food, and are properly prepared with materials. If you cannot attend on this date but would still like to Volunteer with us, please email Bryan Terry, our Volunteer Coordinator, at bryan@thefridacinema.org and he will work with you to make other arrangements for orientation.If you haven't already, please complete our online Volunteer Interest Form prior to attending Volunteer Orientation. This form can be found at http://thefridacinema.org/volunteer/.We thank you once again for your interest in volunteering your time and energy to The Frida Cinema. We look forward to having you come on board!
Bryan TerryVolunteer Coordinator, The Frida Cinemabryan@thefridacinema.org

Poverty, Inc | Hope International.name: Poverty, Inc. | Hope International
Poverty, Inc | Hope International.description:
Please join Hope International for a complimentary screening of the award-winning film, Poverty Inc., on Thursday, February 8, 2018. The event will take place at the We Work Office location at 200 Spectrum Center Drive in Irvine, CA.
Attendees can park for free at the Spectrum and walk across the street to the We Work Office.
After the film, Hope International will present on their work in Haiti and conduct a discussion of the film with the event's attendees.
Please make sure to RSVP and secure your complimentary ticket by clicking the green "Register" button in the top right of this page.
We look forward to seeing you there!


Information on the Poverty, Inc. Film
Watch the film trailer: https://vimeo.com/109863354
POVERTY, INC. has earned 60 international film festival honors including a "Best of Fests" selection at IDFA Amsterdam - the biggest documentary festival in the world.
Share with your friends on Twitter and Facebook using the hashtag #PovertyINC Website: http://www.povertyinc.org/FILM SYNOPSIS“I see multiple colonial governors,” says Ghanaian software entrepreneur Herman Chinery-Hesse of the international development establishment in Africa. “We are held captive by the donor community.”The West has positioned itself as the protagonist of development, giving rise to a vast multi-billion dollar poverty industry — the business of doing good has never been better.Yet the results have been mixed, in some cases even catastrophic, and leaders in the developing world are growing increasingly vocal in calling for change. Drawing from over 200 interviews filmed in 20 countries, Poverty, Inc. unearths an uncomfortable side of charity we can no longer ignore.From TOMs Shoes to international adoptions, from solar panels to U.S. agricultural subsidies, the film challenges each of us to ask the tough question: Could I be part of the problem?

Close-Up Entertainment Hypnosis Playshop.description:
"Can You Hypnotize Me, Right Now?"
When I was getting started in NLP, this happened to me.  Someone at a party introduced me as a hypnotist and I got the question above.  It was in that moment I realized that in all the training I had taken, I hadn't really practiced how to hypnotize someone in a crowded public place.  So I didn't do it... and I regretted not having the confidence...
If you've ever had anyone ask you that question, and if you hesitated even for a second then you're gonna love this!!
I've teamed up with another amazing Master Hypnotist and Trainer, Lisa Kunschick and together we're offering a, LIVE training class coming up in Fountain Valley, California on St. Patrick's Day - March 17th 2018.  Afterward, we're hosting a little get-together where you can put your new talents to use with real subjects (Not just a bunch of other hypnotists!)!
In a full day of intense training, We'll be teaching you how to do INSTANT AND RAPID INDUCTIONS both in a therapeutic context OR as FUN ENTERTAINMENT!!
Maybe more than just knowing how to drop someone into trance at a moment's notice would be thrilling for you... imagine getting paid to do 'Close-Up' hypnosis at parties and events! 
We'll teach you how to get gigs and make fast cash while having lots of fun.And another thing...one of the best ways I've found to attract PAYING hypnotherapy clients is to give them a real experience of what hypnosis can do.  And when people are having fun because of you, that's very attractive!The best part is that after this training, you'll be able to do hypnosis in ANY ENVIRONMENT - noisy parties, restaurants, bars... you name it!  In fact, you'll be able to hypnotize anyone, anywhere at anytime!!  I'm going to keep this invitation short and ask that you to CALL or TEXT  right away if you're even a little bit interested and have a few questions about this training.  760-995-6282  Or you can email me at jaywilliamscoach@gmail.com
Lisa and I will be teaching you how to put your subject into a nice hypnotic trance state in seconds, and some cool things you can do to give them a hypnotic 'phenomena' experience in such a way as they instantly begin to become a true believer.  And how to make a 'show' out of it and let your client be the star!  I'm sure you'll love it and by the time we're done, you will have another way of helping more people and MAKING MORE MONEY!!  (Not to mention some cool new mindset hacks for you! )  :)The regular investment in the training is $900, but if you register now,  BEFORE MIDNIGHT, February 15th you can take advantage of the special, early registration discount!
Your investment in your new skillset is only $297 - if you sign up before February 15th!You could easily make that amount back by booking yourself a private party or two doing 'close up' hypnosis. (And bring plenty of business cards, because everyone will want one!)Seating is EXTREMELY limited and only a few spots are available, so reserve yours quickly!Looking forward to seeing you soon!! P.S.  Naturally you are envited to attend the party as our guest.  Food will be served, bring your own beverages.

2018 SCGA Member Outings - Pelican Hill.name: 2018 SCGA Member Outings - Pelican Hill Golf Club (Ocean North Course)
2018 SCGA Member Outings - Pelican Hill.description:
SCGA Member Outings: Pelican Hill Golf Club (Ocean North Course)
February 28, 2018
If you are not an SCGA member and would like to become one, visit scga.org for information on how to join the SCGA and enjoy all the benefits that we offer.
Entry Deadline:  February 18, 2018 at 12 p.m. 
Entry Fee:  $175 (includes golf, cart, range balls)
Schedule:  7:05 a.m.–12:00 p.m. tee times (At the time of registration please request your prefer starting tee time)
Participant Registration will begin at 6:00 a.m.
Cancellations / Refunds: If participants wish to cancel they may do so by calling or emailing the SCGA Club Services Department at (818) 980-3630 or afredlin@scga.org.  Participants will be issued a refund less $20 processing fee if requested prior to closing date. 50% refund after the closing date.  No refunds will be honored within 48 hours of the event.
If SCGA Members would like to bring a non-SCGA Member, they will be permitted to do so only if there is room for the non-member after the entry closing date. If there is room in the event for the non-member they will be permitted to play at an additional $20 charge. If the site is at capacity, non-members will not be permitted.  
Member Outings
Member Outings present SCGA members of all skill-levels an opportunity to participate in SCGA organized, non-competitive events at premier courses that most would not have the chance to play otherwise. Member Outings aim to increase the exposure of the SCGA to more golfers, particularly to those who may not necessarily participate in SCGA Championship events, as they are open to all members regardless of age or skill level with no handicap index required. Whether you are bringing a group of friends or join as a single, we’ll pair you up with some future friends to have a blast playing some of the most exclusive golf courses in Southern California.
Please note that each Member Outing will have a dress code in effect that all participants must adhere to. This may include the prohibition of cargo shorts, cargo pants, and denim. The dress code will be emailed to each participant along with the pairings for the event.
Pelican Hill Golf Club:
On the coast of Newport Beach in Southern California, The Resort at Pelican Hill sits perched upon 504 acres of sun-drenched hillsides. Inspired by the Italian Renaissance architect Andrea Palladio, the resort village features expansive hotel accommodations with panoramic views of the Pacific. Here, golf, spa and gourmet dining find exquisite expression. 
Deep ocean views to the horizon guide all 18 tee shots on the North Course. Open canyons and elevated plateaus with a palette of a hundred colors contrast the distinct green edges of the fairways and greens. One can feel complete isolation on this course - save for the sound of birds' wings and the salubrious perfume of unique flora. Like its stable-mate, there are several holes on the cliff's edge, adding the Pacific Ocean to one's list of playing partners.

The Boob Ride 2018, Orange County, CA.name: The Boob Ride 2018, Orange County, CA
The Boob Ride 2018, Orange County, CA.description:
The Boob Ride is funding the last mile to fight breast cancer. 
The Boob Ride Orange County starts at the Irvine Transportation Center and finishes in Solana Beach. We transport your bike back to Irvine and you take Amtrak home. You can drop off a bag with a change of clothes at the Irvine station and we will transport it to the finish for you. 
Very Important: Camp Pendleton has a  policy that requires all cyclist to be pre-authorized to ride through the base. You must be registered  here to be authorized to ride through the base. Camp Pendleton requires that YOU register yourself. In previous years, we were able to register all our participants for th Base access. Now they require each rider to register themselves and accept the terms and conditions.
The route options are:

A-Cup, a 30 mile route that is mostly coastal, flat and scenic. This group of riders will be transported with their bikes to Las Pulgas and ride the most scenic 30 miles of the ride to the finish. Click here for the route.
B-Cup, this is a route for those that want to  support the cause and/or start with their friends and turn around returning to Irvine whenever they feel like it. This is a U-turn route option so you can ride with your friends and turn around any where you want to. Click here for the suggested route.
C-Cup, a 60 mile route that goes south through Camp Pendleton, meets the northbound San Diego riders, and then finishes in Solana Beach. Click here for the route.
D-Cup, a 90 mile route that also goes through the base, and continues through the Elfin Forest and Ranch Sante Fe. This is a challenging and hilly, but scenic course. Click here for the route.

Show your support and get a cool t-shirt, hat or jersey.
The post ride party, raffle, and awards ceremony is at the Tidewater Tavern in Solana Beach. Please bring money for lunch and raffle tickets.
Click here for all the ride details and options.
The Boob Ride Orange County is a Fun 4 Good event, a California 501(c)(3) nonprofit. 100% of particpants' fees go to breast cancer charities. Please help recruit sponsors to cover the other minor costs.
Don't be a boob, sign-up today. 
 
FAQs
Q: Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?
Minors 15 or older can ride in the event but must be accompanied by an adult at all times on the ride.
Q: What can/can't I bring to the event?
Please bring your ID, helmet, a bag with a change of clothes and shoes, and money for food and raffle tickets for the post-party.
Q: Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
Yes, please bring your paper ticket to the registration table at the event. 
Q: Is lunch or the return Amtrak ticket included in the registration?
No, participants must buy their own lunch and Amtrak ticket home. This is to keep the registration costs and the operational costs low. 
Q: May I take an earlier or later train back to Irvine?
Yes. However, you must coordinate your own bike transporation back to Irvine, if you are on a later train. If you cannot make the bike pick up time in Irvine before 4:00 PM, please contact the organizer at 949-510-5306.  
Q: What is the refund policy?
All registration funds go directly to the 501(c)(3) charity and therefore no refunds can be provided.

R3 MEGA RUMBLE.name: R3 MEGA RUMBLE
R3 MEGA RUMBLE.description:
R3 MEGA SPARRING RUMBLE
Saturday, February 10, 2018
LYCEUM VILLAGE GYMNASIUM   "New 8,000 sq ft. Gym"

Session One: Grassroots R3 Rumble 
11:00 am - 1:30 pm [All Levels & Ages]
First session/grassroots rumble is for all levels including developmental black belts. Get ready for upcoming State Qualifiers and upcoming tournaments.  Get challenging sparring experience in a controlled environment. 
Session Two: Black Belt R3 Rumble - Black Belts Only!
2:00 pm - 5:00 pm
[9 yr olds, Youth (10-11), Cadet (12-14) , Junior (15-17), Senior (18+)]
Elevate your Sparring Game!  Session Two is for advanced, world class division black belt athletes who want to challenge themselves and fine tune their sparring skills.   
2017 & 2018 AAU and USAT National Team Members FREE!  
Pre-registration required.
 
What is "R3"?
Grandmaster Jimmy Kim, Olympic Gold Medalist and producer of the Jimmy Kim Invitational, introduces a new "Round Robin Rumble" format to offer a superior rumble experience.  All registered athletes will be grouped into comparable weight groups to rumble in a round-robin format.  More sparring time with comparable opponents in an organized format.   The new R3 format allows athletes to maximize and diversify their sparring experience with moderate to challenging matches in a short amount of time.   Come play in a new 8,000 sq ft sparring space and put your skills to the test.

Big Ten Beer & Bowling 2018.description: Big Ten Alumni, friends and family – join us for another year of Beer and Bowling!  As always, we’ll have great bowling prizes, trophies and opportunity drawings for additional prizes. Bowlers of ALL skill levels are welcome, so mark your calendars and sign up today:

Solana Beach or Bust with TUC!.name: Solana Beach or Bust with TUC!
Solana Beach or Bust with TUC!.description:
Join us for our 5th Annual TUC ride to Solana Beach!  This much loved route starts at the Irvine Train Station for a 62 mile ride down the coast to Solana Beach.  At the finish you will find lunch waiting for you at Pizza Port - then take the train back with the group while we transport your bikes back.
Included in the registration is support along the route, all food for the day (including Pizza - the beer is on you!) and bike transportation.  You will need to purchase your own train ticket.
Registration for the event is only $45 and limited to 70 riders - so please register in advance!  All are welcome on the ride (Men and Women), but this route is for experienced road cyclists.  We will begin a women's training group from the shop in Jaunary to get you ready!  Road bikes and helmets required.
See you soon!

Team OC Solana Beach - Spring - 2018.name: Team OC Solana Beach - Spring - 2018
Team OC Solana Beach - Spring - 2018.description:
That's right, we're holding our favorite ride of the year, the Solana Beach Train Ride!  We'll leave the Irvine Amtrak Train Station, do some climbing, and then ride down the coast to Solana Beach.  After enjoying some of the best pizza you will ever eat and a beverage of your choice, you'll put your bike on a U-Haul and board a train (Amtrak Train #785 departing at 4:36pm) for the ride back up to Irvine.
We will be riding through Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton which for heightened security reasons has changed their "open access" for cyclicsts through the base.  All cyclists who wish to enter Camp Pendleton must now request access before doing so. Cyclists are now only allowed on base between the Las Pulgas Gate and Oceanside Main Gate, on the approved bike route. The request is free, can take 7 days for approval, and must be completed yearly.
For that reason we will be closing the sale of tickets for our Solana Beach ride 10-days prior the date of our ride.
This link will take you to the Base Access page which also contains some FAQ's on access to Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton:
http://www.pendleton.marines.mil/About/BaseInformation/BaseAccess.aspx
Click the purple "Camp Pendleton Bike Route Access" button and you will be taken to a short form to fill out.  "I understand that persons desiring access to the installation are subject to all security and installation access requirements, including a background check.  I also understand that if granted access to MCB CAMPEN for the purpose of recreational bicycling, the duration of this access will not exceed 365 days from the day access was granted."
We're offering two routes - a 75 mile route and a 93 mile route; both routes offering challenging climbs.  The 75 mile route takes you up and into Mission Viejo before taking you back to the beach via San Juan Capistrano and San Clemente.  The 93 mile route will take you through the very scenic Santiago and Trabuco Canyons before taking you through San Juan Capistrano and on to San Clemente and San Diego.  Both routes travel through Camp Pendleton, Oceanside, Carlsbad and on to Encinitas and Solana Beach.
NOTE FOR THE 93 MILE RIDERS:
The last safety speech for the 93 mile route option is given at 6:45 am and you must be on the road immediately after it is given. If you are have chosen to ride the 93 mile route and you were not present AND ready to ride at the safety speech given at 6:45 am or earlier and don't depart immediately following it you will be riding the 75 mile route.
If you are wondering if you are ready for this ride, please contact us at leaders@teamoccycling.org and we'll be happy to discuss it with you.
You MUST REGISTER for this ride via EventBrite, please note you can only purchase one ticket at a time as each person must agree to the liability waiver.  This is our MOST popular ride of the year and space is limited.  Registration fee is $30 which goes toward the rental of the U-Haul and incidentals required to put on the event.  $30 fee does NOT cover the cost of your pizza or the train fare.  Pizza and train details will only be provided to ticket holders.  DO NOT WAIT TO REGISTER!  We anticipate a packed registration.  We will not be offering wait listing for anyone!  We limit the number of riders based upon bike shipping UHaul capacity so do not miss out on this great riding opportunity!
This is an offical ALC training ride. We will be abiding by all traffic laws and by all ALC rules.  You must be present and be ready-to-roll BEFORE the last safety speech.  The last safety speech is given at 7:30 am.  Riders not present at the safety speech in ready-to-roll condition will not be provided route slips and will not be considered official participants of the ride.  Refunds will not be provided.

This is a fully supported ride with sweep vehicles and food stops. It is imperative and a requirement that each rider also bring along the standard following items:

Bike
Helmet
Spare tire tubes
Water bottles (1 with water and another with your favorite electrolyte replacement drink) or camel back
Munchies to snack on during the ride (in case you need it) - food and water will be supplied at all rest stops however should you need something between rest stops please always have something on you (Gu or Blocks etc.)

National RPO Clinic.name: National RPO Clinic
National RPO Clinic.description:

Bill Williams - Defensive guru and creator of the "Split Vision" system

Start the day at 9 AM with three one hour sessions covering either side of the ball (your choice), followed by a catered lunch at noon.
The afternoon continues with three more sessions split to either side of the ball, then the two sides come together for a comprehensive "chalk war" and Q&A.
You won't get this level of detail at any other event in football! Seats are extremely limited, so book it now!
