The Upside Down 5K & 10K- Huntington Bea.name: The Upside Down 5K & 10K- Huntington Beach
The Upside Down 5K & 10K- Huntington Bea.description:
*WE HAVE SOLD OUT OF OUR ORIGINAL BATCH OF MEDALS.  WE HAVE ORDERED MORE AND WILL HAVE THEM READY TO SHIP AT THE BEGINNING OF FEBRUARY.  YOU CAN COMPLETE YOUR RACE ANYTIME IN JANUARY OR FEBRUARY!
Who else has become addicted to the new cult classic, Stranger Things?  We LOVE it!   Let’s join the gang from Hawkins Middle School and run (or walk) as fast as we can from the Upside Down!  Join us for our first annual, The Upside Down 5K & 10K!  You’ll have the entire month of January to complete your race!  THIS IS A VIRTUAL RACE!
We will be donating at least 15% of every registration to Operation Underground Railroad (O.U.R.),  which is an incredible organization that exists to rescue children from sex trafficking.   January is Human Trafficking Awareness month and we are doing our part to spread awareness. Help us save more kids!
*For a limited time get an official t-shirt and/or hoodie HERE.
What: This is a 5K or 10K virtual run (or walk) to escape the Upside Down!

When: Complete your race any time in January 2018!
*WE HAVE SOLD OUT OF OUR ORIGINAL BATCH OF MEDALS.  WE HAVE ORDERED MORE AND WILL HAVE THEM READY TO SHIP AT THE BEGINNING OF FEBRUARY.  YOU CAN COMPLETE YOUR RACE ANYTIME IN JANUARY OR FEBRUARY!
Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).Why:  Because this is our way of celebrating one of the greatest shows ever!
Cost:  The price is $18 and that includes your medal, bib and shipping. Plus, at least 15% of every entry will be donated to  Operation Underground Railroad (O.U.R.)   *We are in no way affiliated with this charity, we like to choose a different charity for each of our races and are happy to raise funds for them.
WHAT IS A VIRTUAL RACE? A virtual race is a race that can be run (or walked) from any location you choose. You can run, jog, or walk on the road, on the trail, on the treadmill, at the gym or on the track (or even at another race). You get to run your own race, at your own pace, and time it yourself. Run on your own, or with friends! And your medal will be shipped directly to you.

Be My Volentine - Reverse Co-Ed Doubles.name: Be My Volentine - Reverse Co-Ed Doubles
Be My Volentine - Reverse Co-Ed Doubles.description:
Join us Saturday, February 24th for SoCal FIVA's first grass tournament of the year! In the spirit of Valentine's Day, we'll be doing a Valentine's Day themed reverse co-ed doubles.



Reverse co-ed doubles = women's height net, one guy one girl, guys can only hit behind 10ft line, girls can hit front row. Pools will consist of A, BB, B, and C. There will be a $200 cash prize for the A pool. 1st place BB, B and C pools will receive a prize.


Breakfast snacks will be available during check-in and lunch is provided.


$25/player$30/player after February 9th


**NO REFUNDS AFTER THE 9TH**


Schedule:8:00am Check-in8:30am Captain's Meeting9:00am Pool Play Starts11:30am Lunch
3:00pm Playoffs

**TEAMS ARE NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL PAYMENT HAS BEEN RECEIVED**

Please let us know who your partner is and requested division by emailing us at socalfiva@gmail.com, posting on the FB Event page, or send us a Facebook Message.

Braver Than You Believe 5K- Huntington B.name: Braver Than You Believe 5K- Huntington Beach
Braver Than You Believe 5K- Huntington B.description:
BRAVER THAN YOU BELIEVE 5K
*THIS IS A VIRTUAL RACE!

Did you know that January 18, 2018 is National Winnie the Pooh Day?  To celebrate our favorite bear we are hosting our first annual Braver Than You Believe 5K! The medal has our favorite quote from A.A. Milne, “Promise me you’ll always remember, you’re braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.”   We will be donating at least 15% of every registration to the Foundation for Puerto Rico, 100% of donations to this fund will go exclusively to long-term relief for the victims of catastrophic Hurricane María in Puerto Rico. 
*For a limited time get your official t-shirt and/or hoodies HERE.
What: This is a 5K virtual run (or walk) to celebrate National Winnie the Pooh Day, being BRAVE and to help raise funds for those affected by Hurricane Maria.
When: Complete your race any time in January or February 2018, if you can complete it on January 18th, even better.  
*Medals and bibs will shipping out beginning of February.  We sold out of our first batch of medals and will have new ones ready to go at the beginning of February. After they the will ship within 2 to 5 days of signing up. You can complete your race in January or February!
Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us). Why:  Because this is our way of celebrating our favorite bear!
Cost:  The price is $18 and that includes your medal, bib and shipping. Plus, at least 15% of every entry will be donated to the  Foundation for Puerto Rico.   *We are in no way affiliated with this charity, we like to choose a different charity for each of our races and are happy to raise funds for them.
WHAT IS A VIRTUAL RACE? A virtual race is a race that can be run (or walked)  from any location you choose.  You can run, jog, or walk on the road, on the trail, on the treadmill, at the gym or on the track (or even at another race). You get to run your own race, at your own pace, and time it yourself.  And your medal will be shipped directly to you. Complete a virtual 5K, 10K, half marathon and more!

Zumba U-Jam In the Club (Original Mike'.name: Zumba / U-Jam In the Club (Original Mike's in Santa Ana)
Zumba U-Jam In the Club (Original Mike'.description:
Come join us for this awesome dance party at Original Mike's in Santa Ana!  Zumba and U-Jam Fitness under one roof in a club atmosphere.  Wear comfortable workout clothes, bring your water and a towel as this event promises to be HOT, HOT, HOT! 
Tickets are available now through this link for $15.00.  There will be a limited amount of space for this event so reserve your spot NOW!

Fitness Runner's Mobility Workshop.name: Fitness Runner's Mobility Workshop
Fitness Runner's Mobility Workshop.description:
Training for that first, or even 15th!, marathon? Or maybe you're just starting to run and considering your first 5k...
Wherever you are currently at, if you are considering upping your mileage this year, you need to take care of your body as you log the miles.
Improving your running means more than just tempo runs and adding more miles. It also means strengthening your foundation and making sure you body is mobile and moving well. 
Avoid common running injuries such as Plantar Fasciitis, Achilles tendonitis, knee pain, IT Band issues, hip pain and even low back aches and pains by improving your mobility and activating your GLUTES!
I'll provide you with tips, exercises and workouts to help keep your body healthy that you can easily include in your running programs.
Join me on February 3rd at 9 am for this FREE 2-hour Runner's Mobility Workshop! Come ready to move, roll, stretch and activate!

Mountain bike skills at Santiago Oaks Re.name: Mountain bike skills at Santiago Oaks Regional Park in Orange, CA
Mountain bike skills at Santiago Oaks Re.description:
Join Coach Andy Somerville for a 3-hour class that will take your mountain biking to the next level. 
Mountain biking is the best sport ever 
And the better you get, the better it gets.
For the past 10 years we’ve coached thousands of riders like you to ride safer, ride more confidently, ride faster and have more fun.
We love the feedback and positive reviews from riders like you whose riding and lives have been transformed by the LLB teaching method
We’re riders too, though, and good is never good enough. So now we’re improving our effectiveness to deliver an even higher quality coaching experience.
This sweet video shows what it's like to work with Lee. Watch it on YouTube >>>

Improve on your own — and with our help
At LLB we believe the greatest improvement comes from a combination of individual learning and practice and in-person time with a qualified instructor.
Lots of riders all over the world—beginners to pros—are reaching new levels of shred with the LLBMTB online mountain bike school. When you combine the online learning with an in-person clinic or group ride, your skills — and fun — will skyrocket.
When you sign up for an in-person LLB experience, you’ll receive a subscription to the LLBMTB online mountain bike school. We'll send details after you register. 
What you will learn
Using the unbeatable combination of online learning and an in-person skills clinic or group ride, you can expect to learn about:

Position
Braking
Efficient pedaling
Cornering
Going up and down obstacles safely and efficiently
Pumping bumps
Vision and the Sine Waves of Love

and, when you’re ready,

Drops
Hops
Jumps
and more goodness including FUN!

You’ll see immediate, tremendous improvement in your riding. As you master the fundamentals, it’s a smooth progression to more advanced skills like hopping, dropping, jumping and technical climbing. We build your foundation of great riding — and we show you how to progress as high as you want.
All of our lessons use the same cognitive structure, but each clinic and group ride is unique to the individual riders and the local terrain. Depending on the local trails, you can expect to explore rock gardens, drops, jumps and technical climbs/descents.
NOTE: Any coach who promises to teach you hopping, dropping, jumping or other advanced (and potentially dangerous) skills in a public class is dangerously ignorant or willfully dishonest. We will elevate your riding as much as possible, but we prioritize safety and fun.
In this video world champion Conrad Stoltz and Lee talk about kung fu and shred some Colorado trails. Watch it on YouTube >>>


What stoked riders say about working with Coach Andy Somerville:
Lee,
I wanted to take a couple of minutes to let you know what a pleasure it was working with Andy. This was probably the best investment I’ve made in MTB. If I were to come up with a marketing phrase for your type of work, I’d say: “invest in your skills, not a more expensive bike”.
I do have to tell you: your F6 book definitely prepared me for this session. I was a little tired during the climb, but I had the energy and strength to get the benefit of the downhill sections and Andy’s tips. And I for sure wasn’t destroyed by the end of the day.
Anyway, I know I have a lot of work to do, but I’m excited and I have enough building blocks to work with thanks to you guys. This will not be the last time that I enroll for a class at the Rad Academy.
~Carlos
---   ---   ---
Hi Lee,
Just took a clinic with Coach Andy yesterday. Super cool dude! He helped me fine tune a few of the things from your book I’ve been working on for the past year or so. Should definitely help me pick up a few seconds here and there on my rides. He even helped me squeak out a bit of extra speed to be able to beat him down one of the trails. The mark of a very solid coach I’d say!
Ryan 
---   ---   ---
Hi Lee,
Last week I took a skills class with Andy Somerville in Orange County and it has helped me a ton. Yesterday, I rode a trail where I usually walk two rocky sections but today I walked only one. I would have ridden both sections but lost momentum on one of them. The best part was that I was way more comfortable than I’ve ever been and it turns out that I got a PR on that segment. It was great being in control and having fun. I wish I took this clinic years ago.
Cheers,Mike
---   ---   ---
See more riders comments here >>>

Only 900! Moon Day 720 - One Small Step.description:
*NOW ONLY $9.00! THIS IS A VIRTUAL RACE! EVERYONE IS WELCOME TO PARTICIPATE! We ship your medals to you!  These are from our 2017 race.  You have until June 30, 2018 to complete your race!  The medals are beautiful!
National Moon Day is July 20th, the day man first walked on the moon. To celebrate we are holding a Moon Day 7.20 - One Small Step For Man virtual race. You can complete 7.20 Miles or Kilometers, it's your choice. Everyone around the world is welcome to participate!
When: Complete your race any time in before June 30, 2018.
Where: You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).

Race for the Rings 5K & 10K- Huntington.description:
RACE FOR THE RINGS 5K & 10K
*THIS IS A VIRTUAL RACE!

Winter Olympics are coming back in February!  The games are from February 9th through February 25 in Pyeongchang, South Korea.  We are celebrating the games with a Race for the Rings 5K & 10K!
February is also Eating Disorders Awareness and Screening Week and we will be donating 15% of each registration to the National Eating Disorders Association, NEDA is the primary source for information, resources, support and referrals for eating disorders

Why:  To celebrate the Winter Olympics!COST:  $18, which includes your medal, official bib and shipping.  Plus, at least 15% of every entry will be donated to the National Eating Disorders Association.   *We are in no way affiliated with this charity, we like to choose a different charity for each of our races and are happy to raise funds for them.

You can run, jog, or walk on the road, on the trail, on the treadmill, at the gym or on the track (or even at another race). You get to run your own race, at your own pace, and time it yourself. Resistance is Futile 5K & 10K - Huntingt.name: Resistance is Futile 5K & 10K - Huntington Beach
Resistance is Futile 5K & 10K - Huntingt.description:
RESISTANCE IS FUTILE 5K & 10K

Resistance is Futile 5K & 10K is our fifth annual race inspired by Star Trek.  Participants asked us to do a Borg Cube, so that’s what you’ll get for this year’s medal!   We will be donating at least 15% of every registration to Operation Underground Railroad (O.U.R.),  which is an incredible organization that exists to rescue children from sex trafficking.   January is Human Trafficking Awareness month and we want to do our part to spread awareness.
*For a limited time get your official t-shirt and/or hoodie HERE.
What: This is a 5K or 10K virtual run (or walk) to celebrate all of your Trekkies out there!
When: Complete your race any time in January 2018!
*Medals and bibs will begin shipping out mid-December. If you sign up after that your medals will ship within 2 to 5 days of signing up.Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).Why:  Because this is our way of celebrating one of the greatest shows ever!
Cost:  The price is $18 and that includes your medal, bib and shipping. Plus, at least 15% of every entry will be donated to  Operation Underground Railroad (O.U.R.)   *We are in no way affiliated with this charity, we like to choose a different charity for each of our races and are happy to raise funds for them.

Race Across Australia 5K, 10K, 131, 262.name: Race Across Australia 5K, 10K, 13.1, 26.2 - Huntington Beach
Race Across Australia 5K, 10K, 131, 262.description:
RACE ACROSS AUSTRALIA!
 
Where will your feet take you?  How about a journey around the world?  Yes, that’s right.  Let’s go on a journey.   Sign up for our  virtual races and you’ll get a custom race medal of each country mailed to you and we’ll share fun and interesting facts about each country on our Virtual World Racers Facebook Page.
For each race you can choose the distance you want to complete:  5K, 10K, 13.1 miles (half marathon) or 26.2 miles(full marathon).  Once you complete one country, you can move on to the next!  We’ll post 6 new countries every six months!  Start collecting your medals NOW! This one is to race across AUSTRALIA!
What: This is a 5K, 10K, 13.1 or 26.2 virtual race! You choose your course and time yourself. Race across AUSTRALIA!
When: Complete your race any time in 2018! We only have a limited number of medals, so sign up before they sell out!
*Medals and bibs will begin shipping out at the end of January. If you sign up after that your medals will ship within 2 to 5 days of signing up.Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).Why:  Because we want to race across every country on the planet! 
Cost:  The price is $15 and that includes your medal, bib and shipping. 
By the way, we are donating 10% of each and every race registration to Pencils of Promise, an incredible organization! They build schools to ensure that their students have access to a quality learning environment. So far they’ve been able to build 363 schools since 2009.  Our goal is to donate $35,000 which is the amount it takes to build one school.  So let’s race around the world and build schools along the way! Check out our donation page HERE.
WHAT IS A VIRTUAL RACE? A virtual race is a race that can be run (or walked) from any location you choose. You can run, jog, or walk on the road, on the trail, on the treadmill, at the gym or on the track (or even at another race). You get to run your own race, at your own pace, and time it yourself. Run on your own, or with friends! And your medal will be shipped directly to you.

HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO ME 2018 – IT’S MY BIRTHDAY AND I’LL RUN IF I WANT TO


IT’S MY BIRTHDAY AND I’LL RUN IF I WANT TO!  It’s our second annual BIRTHDAY race!  You can go out and celebrate your own birthday this year with a run, or a walk, and get an awesome birthday cake medal, with glittery frosting on it!  We will be donating at least 15% of every registration to Make a Wish Foundation, so blow out those candles and make a wish!  For a limited time get your official t-shirt and/or hoodie HERE.

GROUNDHOG DAY 2.2 MILE
*THIS IS A VIRTUAL RACE

We all know that February 2nd is Groundhog Day!  So we’re celebrating by running (or walking) 2.2 miles to celebrate 2.2.2018!  The big question is: Will you see your shadow while you’re out there completing your race? Will we get spring or more winter?
February is also heart month, so we’re donating a portion of each registration to International Children’s Heart Foundation, who’s mission is to  is to bring the skills, technology and knowledge to cure and care for children with congenital heart disease in developing nations.
For participating in this event you will get a fun, 3 inch Groundhog Day medal!
What:  This is a virtual race. You choose to complete 2.2 miles in honor of Groundhog Day, which falls on 2.2.2018.  You complete your race on your own and submit your time to us.  Then we ship your medal directly to you.
When: Complete your race on Groundhog Day, or any time during the month of February.*Medals will begin to ship out mid-January.  If you sign up after that they’ll ship within 2 to 5 days of signing up.
Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).
Why:  To celebrate Groundhog Day!COST:  $18, which includes your medal, official bib and shipping.  Plus, at least 15% of every entry will be donated to the International Children’s Heart Foundation.  *We are in no way affiliated with this charity, we like to choose a different charity for each of our races and are happy to raise funds for them.

For each race you can choose the distance you want to complete:  5K, 10K, 13.1 miles (half marathon) or 26.2 miles(full marathon).  Once you complete one country, you can move on to the next!  We’ll post 6 new countries every six months!  Start collecting your medals NOW! This one is to race across SWEDEN!
What: This is a 5K, 10K, 13.1 or 26.2 virtual race! You choose your course and time yourself. Race across SWEDEN!
When: Complete your race any time in 2018! We only have a limited number of medals, so sign up before they sell out!
*Medals and bibs will begin shipping out at the end of January. If you sign up after that your medals will ship within 2 to 5 days of signing up.Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).Why:  Because we want to race across every country on the planet! 
Cost:  The price is $15 and that includes your medal, bib and shipping. 
By the way, we are donating 10% of each and every race registration to Pencils of Promise, an incredible organization! They build schools to ensure that their students have access to a quality learning environment. So far they’ve been able to build 363 schools since 2009.  Our goal is to donate $35,000 which is the amount it takes to build one school.  So let’s race around the world and build schools along the way! Check out our donation page HERE.
WHAT IS A VIRTUAL RACE? A virtual race is a race that can be run (or walked) from any location you choose. You can run, jog, or walk on the road, on the trail, on the treadmill, at the gym or on the track (or even at another race). You get to run your own race, at your own pace, and time it yourself. Run on your own, or with friends! And your medal will be shipped directly to you.

Only 900! Hoodie-Hoo Day 5K- Huntington.name: Only $9.00! Hoodie-Hoo Day 5K- Huntington Beach
Only 900! Hoodie-Hoo Day 5K- Huntington.description:
HOODIE-HOO DAY 5K
*THIS IS A VIRTUAL RACE
THESE ARE LEFTOVER MEDALS FROM OUR 2017 RACE, SO THEY SAY 2017 ON THEM!

 

Okay People! Have you ever heard of Hoodie-Hoo Day?  It’s celebrated on February 20th.  You can complete your race anytime in February or March!
THESE ARE LEFTOVER MEDALS FROM OUR 2017 RACE, SO THEY SAY 2017 ON THEM!
On this winter day, people go out at noon, wave their hands over their heads and chant “Hoodie-Hoo”.
It is a day to chase away winter blahs, and bring in spring.  People are sick and tired of winter at this point and a little crazy being cooped up inside all winter and not seeing the sun.
We are celebrating this year with a Hoodie Hoo 5K!  When you complete your race be sure to wave your hands and chant “Hoodie-Hoo” to help us chase away winter!
The last week of February is also Eating Disorders Awareness and Screening Week and we will be donating a portion of each registration to the National Eating Disorders Association,  the leading non-profit organization in the United States advocating on behalf of and supporting individuals and families affected by eating disorders.
What:  This is a virtual 5K.  You complete your race on your own and submit your time to us.  Then we ship your medal directly to you.
When: Complete your race any time during the month of February or March and be sure to wave your hands, chant “Hoodie-Hoo” and chase those winter blues away!*Medals will ship out within 2 to 5 days of signing up.
Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).
Why:  To chase away winter!COST:  $17, NOW ONLY $9.00, which includes your medal, official bib and shipping.  Plus, at least 15% of every entry will be donated to the National Eating Disorders Association,  the leading non-profit organization in the United States advocating on behalf of and supporting individuals and families affected by eating disorders. *We are in no way affiliated with this charity, we like to choose a different charity for each of our races and are happy to raise funds for them.

SCGA Member Outings - Aliso Viejo Countr.name: SCGA Member Outings - Aliso Viejo Country Club
SCGA Member Outings - Aliso Viejo Countr.description:
SCGA Member Outings: Aliso Viejo Country Club
April 16, 2018
If you are not an SCGA member and would like to become one, visit scga.org for information on how to join the SCGA and enjoy all the benefits that we offer.
Entry Deadline:  April 6, 2018 at 12 p.m. 
Entry Fee:  $65 (includes golf, cart and range balls)
Schedule:  8 a.m. Shotgun  
Participant Registration will begin at 7:00 a.m.
Cancellations / Refunds: If participants wish to cancel they may do so by calling or emailing the SCGA Club Services Department at (818) 980-3630 or afredlin@scga.org.  Participants will be issued a refund less $20 processing fee if requested prior to closing date. 50% refund after the closing date.  No refunds will be honored within 48 hours of the event.
If SCGA Members would like to bring a non-SCGA Member, they will be permitted to do so only if there is room for the non-member after the entry closing date. If there is room in the event for the non-member they will be permitted to play at an additional $20 charge. If the site is at capacity, non-members will not be permitted.  
Member Outings
Member Outings present SCGA members of all skill-levels an opportunity to participate in SCGA organized, non-competitive events at premier courses that most would not have the chance to play otherwise. Member Outings aim to increase the exposure of the SCGA to more golfers, particularly to those who may not necessarily participate in SCGA Championship events, as they are open to all members regardless of age or skill level with no handicap index required. Whether you are bringing a group of friends or join as a single, we’ll pair you up with some future friends to have a blast playing some of the most exclusive golf courses in Southern California.
Please note that each Member Outing will have a dress code in effect that all participants must adhere to. This may include the prohibition of cargo shorts, cargo pants, and denim. The dress code will be emailed to each participant along with the pairings for the event.
ALISO VIEJO COUNTRY CLUB:
Aliso Viejo Country Club features one of only two private Nicklaus Design golf courses in Orange County. With some of the best holes of golf and some of the best views in the Orange County area, the par-72 course at Aliso Viejo Country Club leaves nothing to be desired, and offers an appropriate level of play for all skill levels. Both challenging from the back tees at over 6,500 yards and forgiving from the forward tees, the course at Aliso Viejo Country Club is uniquely appealing to the low-handicap golfer as well as the less experienced golfer.
 For juniors, beginners and women, the course at Aliso Viejo Country Club also features a fast-play course called The Pines Course. This course setup allows inexperienced golfers of any age to practice from tees that match their skill level. The course at Aliso Viejo Country Club offers golfers great holes of golf and a great golf experience at a beautiful Orange county golf course.
 http://www.alisogolf.com
33 Santa Barbara Drive
Aliso Viejo, CA 92656
(949) 958-9200
 Directions: http://www.scga.org/courses/directory
From I-5, exit El Toro Rd.; west to Moulton Pkwy; left to Glenwood Dr.; right to Golf Club Dr.; left to Santa Barbara; right to clubhouse entrance. OR: From the 73 Toll Rd. exit Aliso Creek Rd.; north to Glenwood Dr.; right to Golf Club Dr.; left to Santa Barbara; right to clubhouse entrance.

Full Moon Running and Walking Challenge-.name: Full Moon Running and Walking Challenge- Huntington Beach
Full Moon Running and Walking Challenge-.description:
FULL MOON RUNNING & WALKING CHALLENGE


Did you know that in 2018 we will be having thirteen full moons (there will be two in January)!  Here at Moon Joggers, we LOVE the moon!  We are have created an incredibly awesome Full Moon Challenge medal, with a spinning full moon in the middle that glows in the dark! Plus, this medal is BIG! It’s quite a bit larger than our regular medals.  So it’s time to gear up and get ready for our Full Moon 13 Mile Running and Walking Challenge!  You can compete all thirteen miles at once (one mile for each full moon), or you can split up the distance if you need to, as long as you complete your miles between January 1st and December 31, 2018!  Medals will not start shipping out until the end of May.
If you want to run (or walk) at least one mile for each full moon on each date of the full moon, here are the dates for 2018’s full moons:
FULL MOON CALENDAR 2018 JANUARY 1ST Full Wolf Moon 9:24 pm JANUARY 31ST Full Blue Moon 8:27 am MARCH 1ST Full Worm Moon 7:51 pm MARCH 31ST Full Blue Moon 8:37 am APRIL 29TH Full Pink Moon 8:58 pm MAY 29TH Full Flower Moon 10:20 am JUNE 28TH Full Strawberry Moon 12:53 pm JULY 27TH Full Buck Moon 4:20 pm AUGUST 26TH Full Sturgeon Moon 7:56 am SEPTEMBER 24TH Full Harvest Moon 10:52 pm OCTOBER 24TH Full Hunter’s Moon 12:45 pm NOVEMBER 23RD Full Beaver Moon 12:39 am DECEMBER 22ND Full Cold Moon 12:49 pm
Plus, we will be donating at least 15% of each registration to Soles 4 Souls.  Since 2006 Soles4Souls has collected and distributed 26 million pairs of shoes to those in need in 127 countries around the world and all 50 states in the U.S.
What: This is a virtual run (or walk) to celebrate the thirteen full moons of 2018!
When: Complete your race any time between January 1and December 31, 2018.
*Medals and bibs will ship at the end of May. After that they will ship every 2 to 5 days.
Where:  You choose the course and you time yourself (you’ll report your finishing time to us).
Why:  Because this is our way of celebrating something we love so much….the MOON!
Cost:  The price is $25 and that includes your medal, bib and shipping. This medal is quite larger than our regular medals and has a lot more detail work, so it costs more than our regular races. Plus, at least 15% of every entry will be donated to Soles 4 Souls.  *We are in no way affiliated with this charity, we like to choose a different charity for each of our races and are happy to raise funds for them.

WHAT IS A VIRTUAL RACE? A virtual race is a race that can be run (or walked) from any location you choose. You can run, jog, or walk on the road, on the trail, on the treadmill, at the gym or on the track (or even at another race). You get to run your own race, at your own pace, and time it yourself. Run on your own, or with friends! And your medal will be shipped directly to you.

Wellness Summit 2018 - Huntington Beach,.name: Wellness Summit 2018 - Huntington Beach, CA
Wellness Summit 2018 - Huntington Beach,.description:
Consulte la seccion de abajo para ver informacion en Espanol. 
Friday 6:00-9:00 PM Empowered You Leadership Training (For Elites and higher. Free)
Discover your authentic leadership by identifying your own unique strengths and how using them can help you become a more influential and effective leader. 
Saturday 9:00-11:30 AM The doTERRA Difference (Free)
At dōTERRA, we are on a mission to empower individuals. Education is key to helping people make better decisions toward improving their wellbeing. After learning what makes doTERRA different product demonstration booths will be set up.
Saturday 1:00-3:30 AM Empowered Success Business Training ($10)
Our business experts will teach you how doTERRA can help you prosper financially through our unique business model. 
 For Full Details See Below 
Friday Evening: 6:00 - 9:00 PM Empowered You Leadership Training (For Elites and higher. This is a free training.)
Qualify to attend this Leadership Training by hitting the rank of Elite or above within 3 months of this event.
dōTERRA recognizes that many of our members have a desire to make a huge impact and influence more lives as they share and build with dōTERRA. With that in mind, our “Empowered You” leadership training is designed to help you discover your authentic leadership by identifying your own unique strengths and how using them can help you become a more influential and effective leader. In this training you will learn how to:

Identify and more effectively lead with your own unique strengths and talents 
Develop positive and consist behaviors that will be crucial to your success
Connect and communicate more effectively within your sphere of influence
Match your strengths with your passion to gain a clear vision of your path as a leader
Empower and inspire others to realize their own potential


Saturday Morning: 9:00-11:30 AM The doTERRA Difference (Free to everyone)
Today more and more people are looking for natural solutions to enjoy a healthier lifestyle. At dōTERRA, we are on a mission to empower individuals, families and communities to improve their health and wellness. We believe that education is key to helping people make better decisions toward improving their wellbeing. Now is the time to learn how dōTERRAs product can help you live a healthier and more vibrant life. Please join our Health and Wellness experts to learn:

Why doTERRA is different from other essential oil companies
What makes doTERRA Essential Oils the most potent and effective
How you join us in our mission to make the world a better place
How you can support your Family’s Health using doTERRA’s essential oils and nutritional supplements. 
Following the “doTERRA Difference” presentation, there will be multiple product demonstration booths set up throughout the room where Wellness Advocates and their guests can see how the products work, sample and ask questions.  


Saturday Afternoon: 1:00 – 3:30 PM Empowered Success Business Training ($10 Registration fee per person)
Our business experts will teach you how doTERRA can help you prosper financially through our unique business model. We will teach on the following topics during this session:

Learn how your mindset could potentially be holding you back from wellness and financial prosperity
Discover how to share doTERRA with your friends and family in a way that feels natural
Explore how you can pay for your own products, earn extra income or how to create a career income all by using and sharing doTERRA essential oils
Learn about the tools that will support your efforts in sharing doTERRA and educating people about essential oils


If you need ASL interpretation for this event please email events@doterra.com at least 2 weeks prior to the event so we can arrange an interpreter.


Viernes por la noche: 6:00 - 9:00 PM Capacitación de liderazgo “Tú empoderado” (Gratis para todos)
Califica para asistir a esta capacitación de liderazgo logrando el rango de Élite o superior dentro de tres meses antes de este evento. dōTERRA reconoce que muchos de nuestros miembros tienen el deseo de causar un gran impacto e influir más vidas al compartir y construir sus negocios dōTERRA. Teniendo eso en mente, nuestra capacitación de liderazgo “Tú empoderado” fue diseñada para ayudarte a descubrir tu liderazgo auténtico identificando tus propias fortalezas personales y la manera en que usarlas puede ayudarte a convertirte en un líder más influyente y eficaz. En esta capacitación aprenderás a:
 • Identificar tus propias fortalezas y talentos, y dirigir con mayor eficacia mediante su uso
 • Desarrollar conductas positivas y constantes que serán cruciales para tu éxito
 • Conectarte y comunicarte más eficazmente dentro de tu esfera de influencia
 • Emparejar tus fortalezas con tu pasión para desarrollar una visión clara de tu ruta de líder
 • Empoderar e inspirar a otros para que alcancen su propio potencial
 
 
Sábado por la mañana: 9:00 - 11:30 AM Lo que distingue a dōTERRA (Gratis para todos)
En la actualidad más y más personas andan en busca de soluciones naturales para disfrutar de condiciones de vida más saludables. En dōTERRA tenemos la misión de empoderar a individuos, familias y comunidades para que mejoren su salud y bienestar. Creemos que la educación es clave para ayudar a la gente a tomar mejores decisiones para aumentar su bienestar. Ahora es el momento de aprender la manera en que los productos dōTERRA pueden ayudarte a vivir una vida más saludable y vibrante. Participa con nuestros expertos en salud y bienestar y aprenderás:
 • Por qué dōTERRA es diferente de otras empresa de aceites esenciales • Qué hace que los aceites esenciales dōTERRA sean los más potentes y eficaces
 • Cómo puedes unirte a nosotros en nuestra misión de mejorar el mundo
 • Cómo puedes apoyar la salud de tu familia usando aceites esenciales y suplementos nutritivos dōTERRA
 • Después de la presentación “Lo que distingue a dōTERRA” tendremos múltiples quioscos de demostración de productos por todo el salón; ahí los Distribuidores Independientes y sus invitados podrán ver la manera en que funcionan los productos, probarlos y hacer preguntas.
 

Sábado por la tarde: 1:00 - 3:30 PM Capacitación de negocios “Éxito empoderado” (cuota de inscripción de $10 por persona)
Nuestros expertos en negocios te enseñarán la manera en que dōTERRA puede ayudarte a prosperar financieramente a través de nuestro singular modelo de negocios. En esta sesión enseñaremos sobre los siguientes temas:
 • Aprende la manera en que tu actitud mental podría estarte impidiendo lograr el bienestar y la prosperidad financiera
 • Descubre la manera de compartir dōTERRA con tus amigos y parientes de modo tal que se sienta como algo natural
 • Explora la manera en que puedes pagar tus propios productos, ganar ingresos adicionales o crear un ingreso profesional mediante el uso y compartimiento de los aceites esenciales dōTERRA
• Conoce herramientas que apoyarán tus esfuerzos de compartir dōTERRA y educar a otros en cuanto a los aceites esenciales

UltraFest 2018: UCI's 7th Annual Free Me.name: UltraFest 2018: UCI's 7th Annual Free Medical Student Ultrasound Symposium
UltraFest 2018: UCI's 7th Annual Free Me.description: We are excited to announce that UC Irvine School of Medicine will be hosting its 7th annual UltraFest on February 3rd, 2018! This is a free symposium offered to medical students, physicians, and health care students across the country. UltraFest seeks to teach and develop students’ skills in bedside ultrasound through hands-on practice and small-group instruction with live models and clinician instructors. This is one of the biggest events that the School of Medicine puts on, and we are proud to work with students and share our passion for ultrasound with other schools. We will be updating the website & Facebook page periodically, so please follow us to stay informed about how to get involved, volunteer, and learn on this extremely rewarding and exciting day.

WMBC Presents: Wealth is About Well-bein.name: WMBC Presents: Wealth is About Well-being
WMBC Presents: Wealth is About Well-bein.description:
My motivation to start Wealth Management & Business Concepts was to help people harness the power of money in a way that generates wealth. Too often in my career I have seen successful people run into misfortune not because of inability to accumulate money, but an inadequacy to convert that money into wealth. A significant part of this problem comes from inexperience with financial tools that are available to make the transition. However, over my 35 years of working with individuals and families I have come to realize that how we conceptualize wealth, and our relationship to that concept, can play an even greater role in our progress to wealth generation.
Therefore, it is with great zeal that I announce our latest keynote event: 
Wealth is About Well-being
At the event we will explore


the concept of wealth as well-being;


money not as an end, but a means to creating a meaningful life;


the progress of our investment models; and


the next evolution of wealth planning and WMBC.


As this will be our most significant event to date we wanted the arrangements to reflect its magnitude, and no venue seemed to capture the vision like the historic Port Theater in Corona Del Mar. Originally opened in 1949, the Port Theater has gone through extensive renovations bringing all the elegance of modernization while maintaining its soul as a film and art house.

In similar fashion, we will have the cuisine artists from Fork in the Road Catering there to create an exquisite dining experience.


Wealth is About Well-being is important. The event provides an opportunity for us to share with you the incredible work we have been putting together to benefit the lives of our clients, and without your participation and feedback it stifles our ability to continue to innovate in a way that is beneficial for you. 
We are excited, and look forward to sharing the evening of Saturday, February 3, 2018 together!
Scott Coles
WMBC Founder & President

CAFP Southern California 2018 Procedures.name: CAFP Southern California 2018 Procedures Workshop
CAFP Southern California 2018 Procedures.description:
Welcome to the registration page for the California Academy of Family Physicians' 5th Annual Southern California Procedures Workshop!  
The workshop will be hosted at the UC Irvine Medical Education Building (836 Health Sciences Road, Irvine, CA 92617) on Saturday, February 10th, 2018 from 9AM - 2PM.  Here, you will learn various office-based procedures essential to a family medicine practice.  The courses will be taught by family medicine physicians from the greater Southern California area, including Kaiser Permanente, UC Irvine, UC Los Angeles, and UC Riverside.  
Workshops include: 
- EKG interpretation
- Musculoskeletal exams
- Pap smears / pelvic exam
- IUD insertion
- Suturing 
The day will begin with a light breakfast and registration at 8:30AM on the first floor of the UC Irvine Medical Education Building.  There will be a $5 registration fee that will cover breakfast.  
Space is limited - so register now! We hope you can join us! 
FAQs 
Who is the target audience?
Attendees should be medical students or NP/PA students who are in the training of becoming clinicians.  This will be a hands on course utilizing medical knowledge of anatomy and physiology.  
What are my transportation/parking options for getting to and from the event?
Parking is $10. Depending on number of attendees, parking may be covered.  We encourage you to carpool.  The organizer will attempt to connect attendees from similar geographic regions for carpooling purposes.  
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Please contact Kimberly Vu with any questions at kimvu91@gmail.com.

2018 Registration for the Dental Hygiene.name: 2018 Registration for the Dental Hygiene Study Club for Advanced Learning
2018 Registration for the Dental Hygiene.description:
Our Dental Hygiene Study Club was created to provide continuous learning relevant to the profession of Dental Hygiene to maintain the highest level of professionalism, in a supportive environment. Over the past several years, it has grown to over 175 members and continued to bring quality continuing education to the dental hygienists of Southern Orange County.
We are so excited for our 2018 curriculum! At the October 2017 meeting, we handed out a survey for potential topics for 2018; thank you for your kind responses. We have designed the 2018 Study Club based on that feedback. There will be five meetings will be held at the Laguna Hills Community Center and each session will be 3 units of continuing education.

Oral Infection and Biofilm Control
Thursday, January 25th, 2018 from 6:00pm-9:00pm
Speaker: Ajay B. Setya, DDS., MSD.


Dr. Setya is an accomplished and experienced specialist in all aspects of periodontics, including gum disease treatment, bone regeneration, cosmetic and functional gum treatments and placing dental implants. A long-term desire to help people and have an impact on their lives motivated Dr. Setya to become a periodontist. “I have always wanted to help people in a meaningful way,” he says, “I love restoring my patients’ full oral health and improving their confidence with functional and cosmetic procedures. Old fashion caring and the latest technology are an amazing combination in helping our patients obtain optimal oral health.”

Innovations in Dental Hygiene Products and Instruments
Thursday, March 29th, 2018 from 6:00pm-9:00pm
Speaker: Anna Matsuishi Pattison, R.D.H., M.S.


Anna Pattison received her B.S. in Dental Hygiene from the University of Southern California School of Dentistry in 1967, and her M.S. degree in Dental Hygiene Education and Administration from Columbia University in 1968. She is a Former Associate Professor, and a Former Chair of the Department of Dental Hygiene at the Ostrow School of Dentistry, University of Southern California.
Anna began teaching in the USC Department of Dental Hygiene in 1968. She then served as the Associate Director of Dental Auxiliary Occupations for the UCLA Allied Health Professions Project from 1970 to 1971. Moving to Switzerland in 1971, Anna was a clinician and instructor in the Department of Periodontology at the University of Zurich. She then returned to USC for as an Assistant Professor in the Periodontics Department. After moving to Boston, Anna became an Assistant Professor in the Department of Periodontology at the Tufts University School of Dental Medicine, and a clinical instructor at the Forsyth School for Dental Hygienists from 1973-1975. She returned to USC in 1975, serving as Dental Hygiene Department Chair from 1984 to 1989, and as a full-time Associate Professor until 2003. Since 2003, she continues to work part-time as a Clinical Associate Professor.

Dental Ergonomics
Thursday, May 24th, 2018 from 6:00pm-9:00pm
Speaker: Brian Bradley, Vice President of Therapy Protocol for Egoscue, Inc.


He speaks internationally on the topics of Posture, Pain and Performance and has treated clients such as formed General Electric CEO Jack Welch, Former NFL great John Lynch, golf legend Jack Nicklaus and author and speaker Tony Robbins. Brian is the author of Egoscue Posture Solutions as well as countless articles on the topic of posture and pain.
Brian has always said that he will share the Egoscue message with anyone who is willing to listen! He is honored to have worked with thousands of clients throughout his career, watching them go from disabled and depressed to pain free and living life again!
Co-Speaker: Chris Kussoff, OC Clinic Director of Egoscue Inc.


My Egoscue journey started when i was a personal trainer up in the Portland area. I was doing everything I knew to get my clients in shape: but many of them still suffered from chronic pain and nagging injuries. Sometjhing was missing. The facility where I was working hosted an education event. One of the guest speakers was an Egoscue Method therapist. The Egoscue Method made sense. It was the piece of the puzzle that I had been searching for. I immediatly read all of Pete Egoscue’s books then started using the method with my clients. My next step was a trip to Egoscue headquarters in San Diego. The rest is history. I began working in San Diego in 2000, and I opened the OC Egoscue Clinic in 2004. I have transformed my own body with the Egoscue Method and I continue to share this gift everyday with my clients.


Maintenance of Oral Hygiene with Implant Prostheses
Thursday, September 20th, 2018 from 6:00pm-9:00pm
Speaker: Nadim Z. Baba, DMD, MSD, FACP


Dr. Baba received his DMD degree from the University of Montreal in 1996. Hecompleted a Certificate in Advanced Graduate Studies in Prosthodontics and a Mastersdegree in Restorative Sciences in Prosthodontics from Boston University School of Dentistry in 1999. Dr. Baba serves as a Professor in the Advanced Education program in Prosthodontics at Loma Linda University School of Dentistry and maintains a part-timeprivate practice in Glendale, CA. He is currently the President Elect of the American College of Prosthodontists and an active member of various professional organizations and a Diplomate of the American Board of Prosthodontics and a Fellow of the American College of Prosthodontists and the Academy of Prosthodontics. He is also the Associate Editor for the Aesthetics/Prosthetics/Restorative section at the Journal of Dental Traumatology and a reviewer for the Journal of Prosthodontics and the Journal of Prosthetic Dentistry.
Dr. Baba has received several honors and awards including: The David J. Baraban Award from Boston University, the Claude R. Baker Faculty award for Excellence in Teaching Predoctoral Fixed prosthodontics in 2009 from the AAFP, and the California dental Association Arthur A. Dugoni Faculty award in 2010. He is the author of numerous publications and has recently published a book entitled “Restoration of Endodontically treated teeth: evidence based diagnosis and treatment Planning” and has lectured nationally and internationally.


Bumps and Lumps: What’s HPV Got To Do With It?
Thursday, November 8th, 2018 from 6:00pm-9:00pm
Speaker: Nancy Dewhirst, RDH, BS



Ms. Dewhirst graduated from, and was a clinical instructor in Dental Hygiene at University of Southern California and teaches Oral Pathology, Preventive Dentistry and Infection Control at West Coast University Dept. of Dental Hygiene. She is a nationally recognized speaker, author and consultant, focusing on infectious diseases, clinical safety, instrument sharpening, ergonomics and preventive dentistry. Ms. Dewhirst is a “top 100 U.S. Speaker”, and is on the California Dental Assoc., ADA and OSAP speaker’s / Consultants bureaus. Ms. Dewhirst is an experienced author of journal articles, has contributed to textbook chapters and guidelines such as the 2009 ADA Infection Control Wall Poster, CE courses, newsletters, product literature and website content.

2018 MEMBERSHIP REGISTRATION DUES - $109.00 FOR ALL FIVE SEMINARS

Ajay B. Setya, DDS, MSD, & Robert C. Hirst, DDS, MS

Looking Younger WITHOUT Surgery: A Lifti.name: Looking Younger WITHOUT Surgery: A Liftique Lunch and Learn Premier Event
Looking Younger WITHOUT Surgery: A Lifti.description:
LOOKING YOUNGER WITHOUT SURGERY:
A Liftique Lunch and Learn Premier Event for Women and Men 50+
Keynote Presenters-  Dr. Raja Nalluri, Senior Board Certified Plastic Surgeon for the Liftique Medical Office in City of Orange
Dr. Robert Applebaum. Liftique Founder. Beverly Hills, Board Certified Plastic Surgeon 
Sunday, February 25th 11:30AM to 1:30PM - City National Grove of Anaheim
During the event you will learn:


How new FDA-approved medical technologies are being used to reduce, correct, and postpone the most common signs of visible aging – without surgery or painful procedures.
Scientific facts on how “anti-aging” creams and “skin tightening” serums compare to the latest advances in skin tightening, firming and rejuvenation.
Why increasing numbers of women and men are asking for alternatives to traditional face and neck lift surgery. 
The difference between “non-surgical” and “minimally-invasive,” and why a combination of both treatment protocols is optimal. 
What doctors and patients are saying about The LIFTIQUE™ “One and Done”  Premier Procedure for face, chin, jowl tightening and neck smoothing – as well as unsightly bra rolls and back fat.

You’ll see actual patient before-and-after results and learn how Liftique’s “One and Done” Premier Procedure:

Activates your body’s OWN skin-tightening mechanism -- for a naturally-youthful appearance with no “over-pulled” look.
Offers the “One and Done” advantage over procedures that require multiple, repeat visits.
Delivers an on-going, anti-aging effect that continues improving over time.
Works on face, chin, jowls, neck, and back fat.

 https://youtu.be/zmWS6j1l9zk

2018 AMTA California Education Conferenc.name: 2018 AMTA California Education Conference
2018 AMTA California Education Conferenc.description:
This is the Annual American Massage Therapy Association, California Chapter's Education conference and Business Meeting. 
This years Conference starts off Saturday Morning with our Key note Speaker at 9:30 am
The Vendor Hall opens at 11:30 am
Business Meeting, Elections, and Lunch at 12:00 pm
Saturday afternoon classes begin at 2:30 pm
Sunday classes begin at 8:30 am
Sunday Breakfast 7:15 am
Suday GR presentation with Lunch 12:30 pm

Class Slate
Susan Salvo 
Saturday 3/17/2018 2:30-5:30pm Massage Through Time: Connecting past, present and future
Repeat Sunday 3/18/2018 2:00-5:00 
Hop aboard a time capsule with you tour guide Susan Salvo. She will begin the journey in ancient China, through Japan, Egypt, and then toward India as she discusses massage therapy's ancient history. Next, you will be transported to Greeceand rome, and to the 19th Century Western Europe to visit Per Henrick Ling ay the Swedish Royal Central Institute of Gymnastics. Find out why most massage terms are French. Why did massage popularity soar in the 1980's? What is the role of professional organizations? Waht is the role of research? What are current issues that surround our profession? As we look ahead, where is massage therapy going? Join us for a look back, a tour of the present, and a glimpse into the future. 
Sunday 3/18/2018 8:30-11:30am Massage and Pharmacology
Most of your clients take medications regularly. Reasons why they take medications are pain, high blood pressure, diabetes, and depression. Some of these medications impact the massage session. This course gives you important guidelines on how to minimize the risk of masssage techniquesaggravating medication side effects. Included is information on medications that require special attentionand which drug side effects require referral. Pharmaclogy and Massage will give you the information you need to make safe practice decisions. 

Carol Osborne
Sunday 3/18/2018 full day 8:30am-12:00pm, 2:00-5:30pm Prenantal Massage Therapy Safety Esssentials
*Massage Tables and bolstering/pillows are necessary for this class
With more and more expectant women enhancing their preganancy experience with massage therapy, you need to know the essentials: 

What are the normal physiological and functional cjanges women experience?
How do I safely and comfortably support her position on my therapy table?
What kinds of adaptations to my usual techniques should I make to cause no harm?
What are the signs of medical complication in pregnancy?

This one day face-to-face workshop is where many massage therapist's get started in prenatal massage therapy or begin to take their work to a new level. By featuring each body system's normal prenatal adaptations, we give you bauth the WHY and HOW of prenatal MT safety basics. if you need a solid foundation for working with a woman who is having a normal, low risk, uncomplicated pregnancy, this is the introductory workshop for you. 

Jeff Forman
Saturday 3/17/2018 2:30-6:30 pm The THERABAND Kinesiology Tape method
*Massage tables are needed for this class
Topics include:

History and research
Indications and contraindications
Theory of application
Technique and demonstrations
Hands on practice applying tape to the neck, shoulder, elbow, wrist, lowback, knee, ankle, and foot
How to add Kinesiology taping to your practice

Sunday 3/18/2018 8:30am-12:30pm Balance and Postural stability Training for Massage Therapists
*Massage tables are needed for this class
Reduced Balance is an unfortunate part of the aging process that frequently results in fractures, head injuries, and premature death for older adults. In this class students will learn how massage and sensory motor training can positively influence balance and prevents falls. 
Topics include: 

The anatomy and physiology of balance, which includes the relationship between the musculo/skeletal system, central nervous system, and vestibular system
Balance terminology and concepts such as; centerof gravity, visual, and vestibular systems
Automatic positional response, proprioception, and Static, dynamic, and functional balance
Hands on practice of balance influencing massage techniques for the feet, ankles, lower leg, sacrum, and pelvis
Sensory motor training concepts and the practice of static, dynamic, and functional motor training activities
How to add safe postural stability training activities to their practice



Julie Porter
Saturday 3/17/2018 2:30-6:30 pm Dermoneuromodulation (DNM) workshop
*Massage tables are needed for this class
Participants will learn hands on applications of Dermneuromodulation (DNM). DNM is addressing the nervous system via the skin to allow the client to create change. DNM concepts are gentle, slow, light, and responsive. Participants will also learn the neurology of pain and pain science concepts applied to manual therapy. The first half will be lecture, followed by hands on work. This course serves as an excellent entry point for any manual therapy professional, especially those new to pai science and its applications in their work. Lecture will be followed by 2 hours of hands on practice. 

Johnette du Rand
Sunday 3/18/2018 2:30-6:00 pm Oncology Career Mapping
 If you are already a seasoned oncology massage therapist and want to develop you existing practice and explore oncology related areas to specialize in then join us to hear first hand from therapists already successfully working in the field about which career pathways and practices have served them best. Panel guests include massage therapists who work as sole proprietors or in spa and hospital based settings and specialize in the fields of oncology massage, aromatherapy during cancer care, lympedema management, scar tissue mobilization following mastectomy and radiation, and hospital based massage. This panel program is moderated by Johnette du Rand, founding director of Greet the Day.

After registering someone will contact you within the week to confir your classes

ObesityHelp 2018 National Conference.name: ObesityHelp 2018 National Conference
ObesityHelp 2018 National Conference.description:
The ObesityHelp National Conferences are a celebration of health and wellness for those navigating their weight loss surgery journey. Attendees walk away inspired, motivated and with a larger support system than they started with. They will be part of change, gain knowledge from experienced professionals, and witness (or have) non-scale victories right at the conference.

ObesityHelp.com brings together thousands of patients that are navigating their weight loss surgery journey with a common goal of weight loss, improved health, and wellness. There is always a very special connection among our attendees, one where you can look around the room and know that others right there beside you understand the stigma of obesity and also understand what it is like to make that big decision to have weight loss surgery.
Whether they are a pre-op, post-op, or a weight loss surgery veteran – someone, somewhere at the Conference has been in those shoes and is sure to understand. We’re proud to say that our attendees walk away from the ObesityHelp Conference inspired, motivated, educated and supported!

Learn how to apply time-tested MBA-level management to your office.
Learn how to build a winning team without any hype, fluff, or wishful thinking.
Learn how to get twice as much done in half the time while reducing your stress.
Understand how to learn and commit to operations and logistics, instead of chaos and guesswork.

New Frontiers in the Detection and Manag.name: New Frontiers in the Detection and Management of Diabetic Retinopathy
New Frontiers in the Detection and Manag.description:
Presented by Drs. Paul Chous and Craig Thomas
Learn about the detection and management of both vascular and neurodegenerative elements of diabetic retinopathy using novel technologies like cone-isolation contrast sensitivity, ERG, OCT and OCTA, multi-spectral and ultra-wide field retinal imaging.
New strategies for prevention and remediation of early deficits beyond banal recommendations for "good diabetes control" will be considered.
This event is limited to primary eye care physicians and their staff and family.
About Our Speakers

Dr. Chous completed his undergraduate education at Brown and UC Irvine, and then received his Masters and Doctorate of Optometry degrees from UC Berkeley. Paul has a private practice specializing in diabetes eye care and education in Tacoma, WA. He is the author of Diabetic Eye Disease: Lessons From a Diabetic Eye Doctor, which was included in the “Top 12 Diabetes Books” by Diabetes Update Magazine in 2004.
He is editorial advisor to Review of Optometry and Optometry Times, AOA representative to the National Diabetes Education Program, Primary Investigator for the Diabetes Visual Function Supplement Study (DiVFuSS), and an adjunct instructor at NOVA Southeastern University College of Optometry. 



Dr. Thomas graduated with honors from Dallas’ Skyline High School in 1977 and earned his Bachelor of Science Degree from the University of Houston. In 1983, he graduated from the University of Houston College of Optometry.
Craig has practiced continuously in Dallas, Texas for over 30 years. A noted consultant, lecturer and author, he frequently travels the country to educate optometrists on the latest trends, techniques and technologies in the profession of optometry.
LOCATION INFO: Konan Medical is located at the corner of Irvine Center Drive and Laguna Canyon Rd. The nearest entrance to our building is Laguna Canyon Rd. 
Please call Konan Medical for details: 949-576-2200

2018 CCCC Annual Summit.description:
Better Together: Forging a new path to palliative care
April 10-11, 2018
2018 marks the 10th anniversary of the Coalition for Compassionate Care of California Annual Summit! This special event is designed for physicians, nurses, social workers, nursing home administrators, chaplains and other health providers interested in clinical research, quality and policy as it pertains to palliative care. Complete program information will be posted at ccccsummit.org as it becomes available.
LODGINGWyndham Anaheim Garden Grove12021 Harbor BoulevardGarden Grove, CA 92840
Special Rate: $165/night for Single/Double occupancy through March 15, 2018Register Online: https://aws.passkey.com/go/CoalitionforCompassionateCare or by calling (800) 996-3426
HOTEL CANCELLATIONSCancellation of hotel reservations is the registrant’s responsibility.


CONTINUING EDUCATIONFull attendance at the workshop is a prerequisite for receiving professional continuing education credit. Attendees must provide their professional license number when registering and complete an online survey within 30 days following the workshop to receive a CEU certificate. Certificates will be sent via email within six (6) weeks of the conference.  PLEASE NOTE: 50 minutes minimum of uninterrupted time is required to qualify for one hour of CE credit. Continuing education excludes lunch and break periods. 
Nursing: Course meets the qualifications for approximately 12 contact hours. Provider approved by the California Board of Registered Nursing, Provider #CEP 15403.
Social Work: Course meets the qualifications for an estimated 12 hours of continuing education credit for LMFTs, LCSWs, LPCCs and/or LEPs and required by the California Board of Behavioral Sciences. CCCC is approved by the California Association of Marriage and Family Therapists to sponsor continuing education for LCSWs and LMFTs, Provider #91987. 
Nursing Home Administrators: An application will be made to the California Nursing Home Administration program (NHAP# CEP 1735) for an estimated 12 NHAP/P credits.
Chaplains: This program may be used for continuing education credit for chaplains certified with the Board of Chaplaincy Certification Inc.
Physicians: An application for CME credit will be filed with the American Academy of Family Physicians.


CANCELLATION POLICYSubstitutions are allowed and encouraged, but if you must cancel your registration send written cancellation requests via fax to (888) 789-9475 or via email to info@coalitionccc.org. Cancellations received prior to March 1, 2018, are subject to a $25 administrative fee. Cancellations received on or after March 1 but prior to March 20, 2018, are subject to a $100 administrative fee. No refunds will be issued for cancellations received on or after March 20, 2018.


ANY QUESTIONS?CCCC maintains responsibility for this course and its content. Please contact us at (916) 489-2222 or email info@coalitionccc.org with any questions, to address a grievance, or to request special ADA accommodation needs.
Note: When registering, please use the email address of the person attending the workshop.

Celiac Disease and Gluten-Related Disord.name: Celiac Disease and Gluten-Related Disorders - Advanced Educational Program
Celiac Disease and Gluten-Related Disord.description:
Learn the latest information about celiac disease and gluten-related disorders from two world-renowned experts.  This unique lecture is designed for dietitians, nutritionists, nurses, physicians, patients, and caregivers.  The event was created by volunteers and is co-sponsored by two Southern California non-profit celiac support groups.
Sheila Crowe, MD is the 2017 President of the American Gastroenterological Association and Professor in the Division of Gastroenterology in the Department of Medicine at UC San Diego.  Her talk will address celiac disease, prevention, triggers, the role of genetics, microbiome, infections, different clinical presentations, non-celiac disease gluten sensitivity, and wheat starch and its role in wheat intolerance.
Melinda Dennis, MS, RDN, is an Executive Committee Member of the Celiac Research Program at Harvard Medical School, and Senior Nutrition Consultant to the National Celiac Association. Her presentation will address non-responsive celiac disease, its symptoms, some of its major causes, and specific dietary treatments for symptom relief and to promote healing.  An update on gluten-free oats and arsenic in rice will be included.

Registration begins at 9:15 am and the seminar begins promptly at 9:45 am.
Seating is limited - don't miss your chance to attend this extraordinary event at such an amazing price! 
2 CEs available for registered nurses.  Univ. of California, Irvine, Medical Center - "Provider approved by the California Board of Registered Nursing, Provider #CEP 5 for 2 Contact Hours"
2 Level 2 CPEUs available for registered dietitians.  So many changes have occurred in this field even in the last year.  Share this with your dietitian so they can stay up to date on their training in a specialty where experts are hard to find!!
There will also be some time for Q&A's.
Click here for additional information on the event and speakers.
Park in the structure on Main and Providence.

Early bird registration on or before January 25th
     $25 for registered dietitians and nurses earning 2 continuing education contact hours.
     $8 general admission

Registration after January 25th
    $30 for registered dietitians and nurses earning 2 continuing education contact hours.
    $10 general admission




For additional RDN CEU or ticket questions, contact our Orange County Support Group at (714) 750-9543 or email jevensen@ymail.com or contact San Diego Volunteer Coordinators at sandiegoceliacs@gmail.com.
The event location is conveniently off the 5, easily drivable from LA, Orange County, and is just a little over an hour north of San Diego.  
Also, enjoy samples of gluten-free snacks provided by our wonderful sponsors: 







FAQs
Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?
Childcare is not available.  Please do not bring young children.  Teenagers are welcome.
What can I bring into the event?
You can bring snacks that do not contain gluten.
What's the refund policy?
There will be no refunds.

Workshop: Highly Sensitive People & Arti.description:
Highly Sensitive People & Artists: Being a creative can parallel with heightened sensitivity. Using Elaine N. Aron, Ph.D.’s works on The Highly Sensitive Person, Sharon Chan, LMFT and Boonie Sripom, MA will discuss how to identify traits of being a highly sensitive person, how it can potentially affect our lives, and some ways to navigate the world while honoring one’s sensitivity & creativity.
Please join us at 1888 Center for some Contra Coffee, to meet fellow creatives, and learn about highly sensitive people at this educational workshop.
 

 
Sharon Chan, LMFT is a licensed marriage and family therapist with over ten years of experience working with adults, parents, families, and kids with attention difficulties, autism, and emotional disturbances. She has a private practice in Pasadena and Tustin, CA.
Boonie Sripom, MA is a life coach for artists, geeks, and gamers. She is the personal counselor for the Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising, Orange County Campus (FIDM OC), speaks on MBTI, video game culture, and mental health awareness.

UPLIFT Teen Yoga in Irvine, CA Starts F.name: UPLIFT Teen Yoga in Irvine, CA / Starts Feb. 9th, 2018
UPLIFT Teen Yoga in Irvine, CA Starts F.description:
UPLIFT Teen Yoga  is an eight week journey of self-exploration through yoga, mindfulness, journaling and compassionate discussion. Our goal is to help teen girls connect with their inner wisdom, beauty and peace.

 

Hello Orange County teen girls! We are so excited to meet our group of 12 amazing teen girls who will join us in Irvine :)
UPLIFT Teen Yoga is your chance to take a breath and press pause on the many demands in your busy teen life. We provide a safe and loving space for you to show up and let go of the day. Here you can rest in knowing that you are in the right place surrounded by kind, like-minded girls. This is your unique opportunity to grow and connect.
We meet once a week for eight weeks, and at the end of each two hour session you will feel an overall sense of calm and connection with your core self. Some practical results you can count on are less stress, more positivity, improved concentration, better relationships, and increased self-confidence. Our research-based curriculum blends together the most up-to-date brain science with the most empowering and nourishing practices for the soul. Our ultimate goal is to help you become your own best friend and bring your intentions to life.  Each UPLIFT Teen Yoga group is comprised of 12 teen girls (ages 13-18) plus two certified UPLIFT Teen Yoga mentors to guide you on your journey. Your amazing mentors, Kelsey Delane and Lena Parker, are 200 Hour Registered Yoga Teachers and have completed the Mindful Schools Educator Essentials training. Our non-profit program is donation-based and we always fill up fast! We look forward to meeting you soon!
 Space is limited - reserve your spot today!Please sign up only if you are able to attend all eight sessions. 
 
When:     Every Friday AfternoonFebruary 9th - April 6th(Off March 2nd)
Where:   Ra University18242 W McDurmott, Suite AIrvine, CA  92614
Time:    4:00-6:00 pm
Who:    Teen Girls Ages 13-18All Levels Welcome
Fee:    Donation-Based (Please give what you feel comfortable giving. Our recommended donation is $160 to help pay for expenses.)
 
More Info:  www.UPLIFTyogafoundation.org

DETOX: Start The Year Supercharged!.name: DETOX: Start The Year Supercharged!
DETOX: Start The Year Supercharged!.description:
Time to say goodbye to habits that drain your energy and mess up your gut health and hormones. Enough is enough, it's time to leave behind mood swings, tiredness, brain fog and bloating and those extra pounds that are either lingering for awhile or accumulated after the holidays. 
A good detox is a great way to help your body to heal and re-balance, and since nutrition is the foundation of good health, that's where we start: based on good, tasty, simple foods. During this program you will learn how to balance your meals and choose foods that nourish your body, at the same time you learn to avoid food that are likely to cause inflammation and deplete your health, such as sugar and processed foods. Your nutrition will focus on good fats, protein and lots of vegetables, and yes, it includes some treats too!
In addition to foods, you will learn simple techniques that will help your body to detoxify, manage stress and improve sleep, after all, a healthy lifestyle goes beyond nutrition. 
Let’s start the year in a healthy mindset!
We will meet weekly for 4 weeks, and in between we will have a closed group on Facebook to share recipes, ideas, success and struggles together, support will be there daily, you are not alone in this journey!
The detox program is deep and gentle at the same time. The first week is a transition, where we make sure that you are getting all nutrients you need, before removing or making any changes on your diet and lifestyle. At the 2nd week, we start actively the detox, one step at the time. We don't go cold turkey, we are gentle to the body and let it adapt to one change at the time. This way, is easier to accomplish your goals without facing drastic changes.
Be ready to feel stronger, be ready to feel good! 
Looking forward to start our detox soon! Cheers to vitality!
 Katia

Fee: $85 per person

Egyptian Science of BioGeometry Environm.description:
BioGeometry is based on a growing body of scientific research and is an applied science by virtue of its successful applicability in numerous fields:


The Miracle of Hemberg, Switzerland - saving a town from the negative health effects of a cell phone tower.


Reduction of Thermal Effect from Mobile Phone Radiation Exposure - reduction of temperature on skin surface and tissue during cell phone usage.


Biological Stress Reduction in an Autombile Enviroment - reduction of physiological stress markers in modern electric car.


Animal Farming Research Projects - - livestock animals showed a dramatic health improvement without the need of antibiotics or steroids.


Protective Role of BioGeometry Against Indor Pollutants and Radioactive Pollution - protective effect in lung, kidney and thyroid tissues of rats housed in "sick buildings".


Our homes should be sanctuaries for rest, healing and growth; a place to recover and re-energize before the start of another day. Unfortunately, there is vast undeniable evidence that our modern home environments are more toxic to our health than ever before. We are becoming more and more disconnected from the natural energy dynamics of health and wellbeing in our insulated, artificial environments. As open energy systems, we are engaged in constant resonant and harmonic energy exchange with our environment. At this time in history, we are overwhelmed with disruptive dynamics from various environmental stressors such as mobile phones, WiFi, electrical system in modern cars, toxic building materials, and earth radiation gridelines.
BioGeometry is founded by the Egyptian architect and scientist, Dr. Ibrahim Karim. It is based on 45 years of applied research using subtle energy principles of geometric shapes to qualitatively harmonize our biological energy systems and the environment. BioGeometry is leading the evidence-based research that integrates, rather than divides our world-view, thus narrowing the gap between the energy manifestations of spirituality and science.
Join Jean Menges for an introductory lecture on BioGeometry Enviromental Home Harmonization. All participants will learn how to harmonize their home using the general public BioGeometry products that were developed and applied in various environmental harmonizing research projects. 
Jean Menges is a Licensed BioGeometry Environmental Home Solutions Practitioner and an acupuncturist practicing in New York City. Jean has extensive training and background in bioenergetic medicine, nutrition and herbal medicine. She also has a background working in research on molecular genetics and infectious disease. She is a teaching assistant for the BioGeometry Foundation and Advance Training, and an official retailer of the BioGeometry personal energy balancing and home harmonization products.
Here is more information about BioGeometry and learn more on YouTube.
Order online products for EMF harmonization, personal energy balancing, and home & car protection products.  Limited products will be available for sale after the lecture.

The Aging Brain - Free Holistic Health E.name: The Aging Brain - Free Holistic Health Event
The Aging Brain - Free Holistic Health E.description:
Most of our lives have been touched in some way by brain issues related to aging, whether it be watching someone we love suffer or our own fears for our future. We are told that Alzheimer's and dementia are just a normal part of the aging process and jokes about memory loss or forgetting things start to fill our lives.
We may start noticing and worrying about aging brain symptoms like:

Brain fog
Trouble focusing or concentrating
Fatigue
Decreased memory
Constipation that is hard to resolve
Inability to handle stress
Restless mind
Inability to turn your mind off
Disorganized attention
Loss of enjoyment in life

But, you don't have to accept this as your future. You have the ability to nurture your brain and keep it healthy and active. 
At our next free event, Dr. Ennen will be sharing what you need to know to protect your brain and keep it functioning at it's best for your lifetime. He will provide simple steps you can start taking now to ensure a bright future for yourself.
Please join us at this FREE event to learn more and don't forget to bring your friends.

MaxLove Projectempowers families fighting childhood cancers and related life-threatening conditions with quality of life care, fierce foods, whole-body wellness resources, education and research. We believe that true health starts when families are empowered to be active partners in their child’s healing.Special thanks to the incredible team at The Bar Method Tustin for hosting and supporting MaxLove Project!
****The day of the event, please show up to the Bar Method Tustin 10 - 15 minutes early to allow time for you to sign waiver forms if you're not a current Bar Method Tustin member.

Laguna Beach - Intro to Vedic Meditation.name: Laguna Beach - Intro to Vedic Meditation at 10:00am
Laguna Beach - Intro to Vedic Meditation.description:
Finally, a meditation that you actually want to practice.

STEP 1: ATTEND A FREE INTRODUCTION TO VEDIC MEDITATION 
This free workshop will introduce you to Vedic Meditation, a time-tested, technique that quickly provides us with the results we crave. The effect is a feeling of inner wakefulness and peace while also allowing the body to rest at profound levels. 
We’ll discuss how this practice is truly effortless and yet delivers profound results on the body and mind. It is an interesting workshop and you will leave with a new understanding of meditation.

STEP 2: MEDITATION COURSE
Become an expert meditator in four days of about 2 hours each day.
Day 1: Meditation BasicsDay 2: Meditation GuidelinesDay 3: How Stress Releases in the BodyDay 4: The Future of Your Meditation Practice and How to Make This a Daily Practice

STEP 3: ENJOY A LIFETIME OF FREE GROUP MEDITATIONS AND SUPPORT
After taking the course, you will enjoy a lifetime of free group meditations within our worldwide community and free refresher courses. You’ll also be able to ask Vi and Jeff questions about meditation as your practice progresses and changes.
 
For questions please email Vi at vi@effortlessglow.com or www.EffortlessGlow.com
