 To all registered guests
What to expect: 
All registered guests in our trunk show are able to browse our jewelry collection freely. If you are interested or would like to take a closer look, one of our experienced jewelry consultants will be present to accommodate your requests.
Please keep in mind that placing orders can take up to two hours, including consultation (discussions of options such as design preferences, wood-grain application, a width of the ring, number of pieces, gemstone selection, engravings, etc.) until full confirmation of your order is complete.
 
Payment options 
・Bank transfer・PayPal
Production of an order will begin after payment is confirmed. 
 
For further inquiriesPlease contact us via e-mail: english@mokumeganeya.com



 
About MOKUMEGANEYA
Each piece of jewelry is handmade by our highly-skilled Mokumegane craftsmen, known for creating quality that is recognized worldwide.
We are the only company to establish the Research Institute of Mokumegane, to practice, preserve and research traditional techniques that we incorporate into all of our rings.
Each of our rings is made in our Atelier in Omotesando, Tokyo. To date, we have handcrafted over 20,000 pieces of Mokumegane jewelry used by many couples as wedding rings. It is our mission to share this unique artisan jewelry with you, which is the pride of Japan, and to bring its shine into present-day life.
 
To learn more about MOKUMEGANEYA, visit OUR WEBSITE.

Microblading Training serving the Orange.description:
Intense 4 Day 3D Microblading™ Career Training Course

Our 4-day course focuses heavily on the artistic principles of 3D Microblading™ Eyebrow design with an emphasis on our students getting comfortable creating the perfect shape, leaning how to create natural looking strokes and the fundamentals of 3D Microblading. Class sizes are small to ensure each student will have the ample time to ask questions and receive one on one time with instructors to ensure a strong technique before working on live models.
Students will be required to provide proof of passing their Blood Bourne Pathogen test (available online for as low as $25 depending on state you’ll be working out of) and work on two live models that receive clearance from instructors prior to course completion.
Our instructors will mentor you to launch your career and provide you with a 3D Microblading Career Training Certification and endorsement upon graduation.
Hands on 4-Day Training includes:


Microblading, Corrections and Microshading training all for the price one one!


3D Microblading™ career starter kit with enough tools to do up to 14 clients on your own and start making your money back


3D Microblading™ Technique Certificate awarding 32 hours of hands on training


Our facility to schedule live models, supervised by a master tech


Book a chair at our gorgeous studio to take your clients and start earning $


Hands-on 4 day training covers the following:


One on one hands on training 


Proper handling of equipment to follow health code regulations


Measuring facial features


A complete list of what is required to launch your own business


Various eyebrow designs 


Infection control


Safety and Compliance


Understand skin, including age, texture, and undertones


Skin preparation


Correct pressure


Micro-stroking techniques


Micro-stroking tools


Instructor procedure demonstrations


And more!


​

Reusable 3D Microblading™ Eyebrows tote

Wipes

Mask
4 Aftercare ointment
4 Alcohol pads
Eyebrow measuring tape
2 pencils for drawing shape
Sharpener
Box for tools
Completion Certificate

Learn Microblading, Corrections and Microshading all for he price of one!4 Day  Accelerated Certification Course Normally $4500. Now only $3900 for a limited time.

24th Annual Orange Plaza Car Show.name: 24th Annual Orange Plaza Car Show
24th Annual Orange Plaza Car Show.description:
Open to all pre-1976 vehicles
Old Towne Atmosphere Restaurants Unique Antique Stores Art Galleries Drawings and Giveaways Over 30 Trophies and Awards DJ Thumper Spinning the Oldies 30 Specialty Vendors
Show Hours 8 am to 3 pm
Orange Plaza Rotary is the proud host of the Annual Orange Plaza Car Show.  Money raised will help fund community outreach programs, youth education, and literacy programs.

Nearly 400 pre-1976 Street Rods, Custom and Classic vehicles will be on display. The show is estimated to bring out 15,000+ spectators to the beautiful Plaza area in the City of Orange. It is a wonderful event for the entire family to enjoy. Local restaurants and shops will welcome all in attendance. There is no admission fee for spectators. The show will run from 8:00am to 3:00pm.
Registration for car show entries will begin on February 1, 2018 at 8 AM. PLEASE NOTE: WE SELL OUT WITHIN 2-3 DAYS. Once we sell out, no more spaces are available. However, we do have standby registration on the day of the event. 

FAQs
What are my transportation/parking options? 
The Orange Plaza Car Show is a short walking distance from the Orange Transporation Center.  Take the Metrolink or OCTA and you are there!  
Driving to the show?  Get off the 57 or 55 freeways at Chapman Avenue and head toward the center of Orange. You can't miss us!  Free parking available in public lots surrounding the Orange Plaza Car Show.
What Can I Bring Into the Show?
You are welcome to bring your childen and infants in strollers, bottled water and snacks in coolers.  WE DON'T ALLOW PETS, GLASS CONTAINERS, RECREATIONAL SCOOTERS, ROLLER SKATES OR BICYCLES.  NO ALCOHOL!!!  WE HAVE A ZERO TOLERANCE POLICY AND ALL VIOLATORS WILL BE CITED BY ON-DUTY ORANGE POLICE OFFICERS.
What's the refund policy?
Our show is rain or shine and we do not issue refunds.  For more information about our rain policy, please visit our website.

About your host:
•Mariela F.
I've been working in finance for over 8 years, and within that time I've undertaken management and leadership roles for over 5 years, I'm currently in a regional consultant position. I'm also an Investor, and a motivational speaker, I enjoy networking, watching motivational or funny videos, I have two dogs and they are my best friends, I married the perfect man for me, I've been able to help others in individual self development and one on one coaching, I've also studied Neuro Linguistic Programing, and practice Law of Attraction and faith filled gratitude daily. 
When I first learned about Vision Boards 10 years ago, I was fell in love, but I realized that many people didn't know how to use their positive thinking to promote the items that they listed, so I wanted to have a class to help other women achieve their goals, Ive been able to set my own personal goals and achieve them by staying motivated, focused, consistent and hungry for success. 
I know you will learn so much from my team of presenters from health, to mommy blogger advice, motivational stories, positive influences and hands on guidance when creating your vision board. Understanding Your Digital Camera Levels.name: Understanding Your Digital Camera Levels 1 and 2 with Art Ramirez – SA
Understanding Your Digital Camera Levels.description:
Understanding Your Digital Camera LEVEL 1:
This is a basic class for individuals who own a point-and-shoot or Digital SLR camera and wish to learn more about navigating through all those confusing camera modes.
We will discuss the very basic operation of Digital cameras, such as setting your camera’s resolution, basic flash operation, basic menu functions, memory cards, storage and more.
This class is not specific to any particular camera manufacturer, so whether you purchased the camera for yourself, or received it as a gift, this is the class to get all of your questions answered!
Class duration is two and a half hours, with time for questions.
—-
 

Understanding your Digital Camera LEVEL 2
Understanding Your Digital Camera Level 1 got you up to speed with your camera and its menus and buttons, now learn how to really dive in and get those shots you are looking for.
Art will guide you through various photography situations and how best to use your camera. You will walk away from this class with having a better understanding of you camera and the confidence that goes along with it.
Some topics discussed will be: Exposure, light metering, auto focus, shutter speed, and aperture.
Here is the schedule for those who register for both:
– Level 1 is 10:15am to 1:15pm
– Lunch: 1:15pm to 2:00pm
– Level 2 is 2:00pm to 5:45pm

Hands on Power-User Training with Fujifi.name: Hands on Power-User Training with Fujifim Mirrorless
Hands on Power-User Training with Fujifi.description:

Bring your own Fujifilm equipment if you have it and find out how to make the most of your investment. Course will tackle not only the quick and easy shortcuts to optimizing your image capture, but will go deep into hidden menu items and special operations that the pros like most. Best choices of lenses will be covered, as well how to get best results from flash both on-camera and in studio. Also covered will be tips on bettering your artistic vision.
 

 
 
 Michael Bulbenko / Fujifilm North America

Beginning Studio Lighting with Joe & Mir.name: Beginning Studio Lighting with Joe & Mirta Barnet - SA
Beginning Studio Lighting with Joe & Mir.description:
In this 3 1/2 hour hands on workshop we’ll cover the principles of studio lighting and posing, using professional studio gear. We will create several, one and two lighting set ups. We will explain and demonstrate in very simple terms distinctive lighting patterns, ratios and metering. The studio can be intimidating, but after this class you’ll feel very comfortable in this environment, where once you understand a few basic principles, your creativity won’t be limited by weather, bad backgrounds or time of day. You will think of the studio as the fun playground it is for us. This workshop will take the mystery out of working with professional studio lighting, modifiers and metering. We will slowly build each lighting set up, explaining how everything comes together to bring our vision to reality. That’s the beauty of studio work, it’s a controlled environment where we are free to create! We’ll have a model for this workshop, and PocketWizard triggering devices will be provided.
Topics covered: We will work with self contained AC and battery powered Profoto D1 and B1 monoblocks, as well as power packs and heads. We’ll use reflectors, umbrellas and soft boxes. We will also talk about posing to make your subjects look their best, depth of field choices, positive and negative fill, using a light meter for fast accurate exposures and setting up your own portrait studio.

Portrait Mentoring Series with Scott Rob.name: Portrait Mentoring Series with Scott Robert Lim: Workshop#3 - Mastering Top 20 Tips on Posing
Portrait Mentoring Series with Scott Rob.description:
Are you looking to deepen your portrait skills by studying under a world renowned photographer? Sony Artisan and international master photographer Scott Robert Lim will teach an exciting series of one-day portrait workshops in Southern California.
Each workshop, four in all, will consist of a lecture that will focus on a vital aspect of on-location portraiture followed by a live, hands-on shooting session with models.  The hands-on shooting session will give attendees the opportunity to reinforce the concepts taught. Don’t miss this exciting opportunity to be mentored by one of the best photographers in the world. Take any one of the four workshops, the first is not a prerequisite to the next.  Enroll in the entire series and receive a discount!

 
Workshop #3: Mastering Top 20 Tips on Posing 
 
Posing is a very difficult skill to develop but the skill must be mastered for consistent results. Learn the best techniques and Scott’s simple “go to” techniques that has turned him into an international superstar. Learn how to maximize the beauty in any subject and how to incorporate the pose with a great composition and lighting to create images with great impact and beauty.
Topics that will be covered:

Posing Basics
Hand Techniques
Creating Balance
Posing Couples
How to Pose when your Subject Can’t
How to use Composition and Light to Enhance your Pose

 

 
 
 

Instructor Bio:  Scott Robert Lim is a certified master educator and has over 70 international awards to his name, including top Ten Most Influential, Kodak Award, World’s Top Wedding Photographers and has been a judge at many international photography competitions. His work has been published and viewed by thousands all over the world and he is a popular speaker on Creative Live. For the last decade, Scott has dedicated his career to developing world class photographers.  He loves teaching photographers of all levels. He has an energetic and charismatic speaking style and is an industry leader in photography education.

Orange Basic Safety - Orange.description: Prerequisite for All Orange Rockler Hands-on Classes

Intro to Pen Turning - Orange.name: Intro to Pen Turning - Orange
Intro to Pen Turning - Orange.description: Intro to Making Pens on the lathe. Hands-on Class

\u2665 Valentine Wine & Signs.name: ♥ Valentine Wine & Signs
\u2665 Valentine Wine & Signs.description: We are heading to the cellar for this Wine and Sign Night! Join us at our neighbor, Frisby Cellars for the perfect blend  Wine and DIY!  You will put your favorite LOVE saying on wood with a variety of stencils and paint colors. Workshop includes 1 wood sign ( 10x12), instruction, materials, snacks and 1 flight of Frisby Cellars Wine.

Paint & Drink Night: Create Your Own Cus.name: Paint & Drink Night: Create Your Own Custom Hat!
Paint & Drink Night: Create Your Own Cus.description:
What is this? Well, you've probably heard, seen, or even maybe participated in the ever popular 'paint and and sip' nights before, fun right? Well, well known traveling artist Sarah Ashwood will be adding a little bit of a different flare to the night. She's known for her commissioned artwork all over the country and custom painted hat designs and with her instruction, you'll be custom painting your very own 'Mountain Themed' hat!FAQ:How long is it going to take: We like to allow for about 2 hours for the painting itself, it is encouraged to arrive at least 30 minutes early to find your seat and get settled with your beverage.What's included in the price? All supplies you'll need to create your custom hat is included in the price. 2 hour instruction by experienced traveling artist, Sarah Ashwood, AND of course your first pint is included in the price as well.Is there an age limit? Yes, this is a 21+ establishment.What should I wear? You will be provided with an apron but we recommend you wearing something that you wouldn't mind getting paint on - just in case!Is there assigned seating? No, we won't make you split up from your friends.
What if I'm a newbie to painting? Don't worry, this is supposed to be fun, even if you have years of experience or none at all, you'll be given a step by step process of painting a lovely design on your hat.Are there refunds if I absolutely hate my hat? Unfortunately, no. If you don't wish to keep the hat for yourself, they make great gifts!

California Center for Photography & Digi.name: California Center for Photography & Digital Arts Open House
California Center for Photography & Digi.description:
Join us for our Open House featuring four different photographers and their work.
Meet:  
 Monica Royal  Tasha Peterman David Moyle Dan Holmes 
Fun, food, creativity and nice people! You will meet other photography lovers 
Afterwards, feel free to stroll the downtown Santa Ana's Artwalk for more art and fun!
For questions or more info click here

Learning how to shoot Boudoir Photograph.name: Learning how to shoot Boudoir Photography
Learning how to shoot Boudoir Photograph.description:
Boudoir Photography is a specialized class in that there are many techniques, poses and lighting setups to learn. Join us in this 6 hours class to learn and practice with models on how to photograph this delicate style of photography: Boudoir. 
Click here for additional information and questions

Learn How to Photograph Creatively in P.name: Learn How to Photograph Creatively in  Photographic Composition Class
Learn How to Photograph Creatively in P.description:
Photographic Compositions
         Creative Seeing for Stunning Photographs
 

RULING IN (OR OUT) THE RULES OF COMPOSITION 
Why is it that two photographers can capture the same subject, sometimes standing within a feet of each other, and one creates a stunning photograph and the other creates a mediocre or worse? The difference—one knows how to compose an image that allows him or her to create a stunning visual statement and the other, well… Composition gives you the tools you need to be able to create a shot that stands out, shows your style, communicates to your audience and teaches you to see like an artist.
Students learn the creative photographic composition and creative ways to apply them.
For additional information, click here
 
More questions? Give us a call at (714) 529-4686

Camera Class: Shooting in Manual Mode he.name: Camera Class: Shooting in Manual Mode held in Orange County
Camera Class: Shooting in Manual Mode he.description: SHOOTING IN MANUAL MODE  and Mastering your camera’s manual exposure system. Get out of automatic and learn how to use your manual exposure. Now you can be more creative and tell your camera what to do to get the shot you want and envision. After taking our TV and AV mode courses, and you’re ready to take your photography to the next level, this is the course for you. During this small class, you will have your instructor by your side, teaching and helping you along the way.

Lighting Basics Using Your Indoor Flash.name: Lighting Basics Using Your Indoor Flash
Lighting Basics Using Your Indoor Flash.description:
Lighting Basics Indoor Flash
In this class, students quickly develop the skills to manage and choose portable flash settings for indoor applications. Students learn how to use portable flash as a dominant light source and explore best practices for selecting ISO, exposure settings, and flash power requirements appropriate to any given ambient light situation.
Click here for more info or any questions you may have!

Kids Summer Photography Camp In Orange C.name: Kids Summer Photography Camp In Orange County
Kids Summer Photography Camp In Orange C.description:
One Week Summer Photography Camps
The California Center for Digital Arts Summer Photography Camp is ideal for any young and budding photographer.
This fun photography camp teaches kids how to use the elements of photography to take better shots and develop their interest in the art of digital photography. They will not only learn how to use their camera  but why.  Understanding why they are adjusting the settings on their camera will make sense so they can achieve the look and feel of what they would like to create.
 Different types of photography are explored such as studio and portrait photography, documentary photography, street photography, and photojournalism.
Any questions? Click here to find out more!

Kids Summer Photography Camp in Orange.name: Kids Summer Photography Camp in Orange County
Kids Summer Photography Camp in Orange.description:
One Week Summer Photography Camps
The California Center for Digital Arts Summer Photography Camp is ideal for any young and budding photographer.
This fun photography camp teaches kids how to use the elements of photography to take better shots and develop their interest in the art of digital photography. They will not only learn how to use their camera  but why.  Understanding why they are adjusting the settings on their camera will make sense so they can  achieve the look and feel of what they would like to create.
 Different types of photography are explored such as studio and portrait photography, documentary photography, street photography, and photojournalism. Explore, learn and photograph as we walk through the Artist Village near the photography school.
Any questions? Click here to find out more!

Camera Class: After The Auto Mode in Ora.name: Camera Class: After The Auto Mode in Orange County
Camera Class: After The Auto Mode in Ora.description:
After The Auto Mode
Come learn to understand your camera’s exposure modes. Let’s get out there and advance our basic camera skills! Taught at our photography school in Orange County, you will learn how to use the  AV / TV Priority Modes on your camera. This will give you the control of what you want when shooting and telling your camera what to do. 
To learn more click on After The Auto Mode or give us a call at (714)529-3686

Table Top Product Photography.name: Table Top Product Photography
Table Top Product Photography.description:
Table Top Product Photography

Learning about Product Photography is essential and one of the most important classes you can take. Product Photography is all around us. We constantly see the beautiful billboards, magazine ads, in-store product shots that are very successful and make us want to buy.
So, whats it take to become a good product photographer?  Learn the lighting, the set ups, power choices, camera settings and more in this interesting and beneficial class!
Click here for questions or more information!

Orange County's 1st Dominoes board game.name: Orange County's 1st Dominoes board game group
Orange County's 1st Dominoes board game.description:
Orange County's 1st Dominoes board game group.

Inaugural date will be Tuesday July 11th, 2017, from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm at Bagels & Brew 26601 Aliso Creek Rd, Ste D, Aliso Viejo CA 92656.

The meet-up will be every Tuesday starting July 11th, 2017 from 6-8 pm.

BECOME A CERTIFIED PROFESSIONAL PHOTOGR.name: BECOME A CERTIFIED PROFESSIONAL PHOTOGRAPHER
BECOME A CERTIFIED PROFESSIONAL PHOTOGR.description:
How do I become a certified photographer? First you need to take all of the basic foundation courses. A few intermediate courses are next and then you are ready to take the Certification Course.

At the California Center for Digital Arts in Orange County, we are now offering the course and exam to become a Certified Professional Photographer with the Professional Photographers of America. CPP from PPA
Taught by Dr. Jose E. Quintanilla M.Photog.CR, CPP, M-PPC
Click here to read more what this is about

Learn how to use your Camera in Basic Di.name: Learn how to use your Camera in Basic Digital Photography 1
Learn how to use your Camera in Basic Di.description:
We are about “Hands On, Mentored Learning”.
. 
Come learn how to use your camera, what all those buttons are for and learn some basic photography in this beginning photography class taught in Orange County at the photography school. You will also learn about the foundational principles of photography and will begin to apply and practice the same day. Make sure to bring your camera as you will begin to shoot better pictures! 
To Read More about this class, Click Here
If you would like to talk to someone, please give us a call at: (714) 529-4686
 
Course Days and Hours:
1 day, 3 hours

Learn Adobe Lightroom for the Beginner.name: Learn Adobe Lightroom for the Beginner
Learn Adobe Lightroom for the Beginner.description:
Lightroom 1 is for beginners in an introductory two-day course for both hobbyist and professional photographers. This course will teach you how to organize, process, enhance, and share your photos using Adobe Lightroom!
Taught hands-on by an Adobe Certified Instructor, this class is limited to less than 10 students.
Click here for additional information

Photoshop 1.name: Photoshop 1
Photoshop 1.description:
Photoshop 1
Come learn Photoshop in Orange County in this small, hands-on course. This course is geared for the beginner. Taught by an Adobe Certified Instructor, you will learn from the beginning, a step at a time.
Photoshop is a powerful visual application for almost anyone involved with images.   One can create stunning photographic images, graphic art work, paintings, illustrations, type settings, composites, real and surreal messages— in fact you can create your own reality, or the reality desired by clients.

At the California Center for Digital Arts, teachers are mentors and learning is hands-on. 
This methodology encourages you to learn Photoshop by doing, not by watching pre-recorded tutorials. 
Classes are small so that you can ask questions and interact with your fellow students, and your instructor is by your side providing hands-on help to guide your image creation.



Click here to see full lesson plan.



Would you like to talk to someone? Call us at: (714) 529-3686

Finding and Mastering Natural Light Phot.name: Finding and Mastering Natural Light Photography Course
Finding and Mastering Natural Light Phot.description:
Finding and Mastering Natural Light Photography Course is taught in Orange County. You will learn how to photograph in natural light by learning the techniques, tools, equipment needed and skills taught by Master Photographer, Tim Meyer. Two day course, small class size, instructor by your side.
Click here for questions or additional information.

Sharpening Basics - Orange.name: Sharpening Basics - Orange
Sharpening Basics - Orange.description: Learn how to use diamond stones, Sharpening Machines like the Tormek and WorkSharp Systems. Hands-on Class.

Division B 2018 International Speech & E.name: Division B 2018 International Speech & Evaluations Contest
Division B 2018 International Speech & E.description:
Reserve a spot for the Division B Speech Contest held in Costa Mesa and come observe competitors vie for a spot in the Founder's District contest on their way to the International Speech Contest this year in Chicago.
While you're here, don't miss out on fun prizes awarded in the Opportunity Drawing.

DIY Chalk Paint Your Own Piece.name: DIY Chalk Paint Your Own Piece
DIY Chalk Paint Your Own Piece.description: Is it time to fresh that tired piece of furniture with DIY  100% Natural  Clay Based Paints? In our paint your own piece workshop you will learn to paint your furniture like a pro.  We teach you everything you need to know to create a gorgeous, professional finished project, add distressing with sandpaper and even a damp rag!  Your piece will be finished with DIY 100% Natural wax or one of our beautiful clear coats to protect your gorgeous paint finish. Participant will bring a small piece of furniture a chair, small side table, stool (if you have a question about the item you plan to paint, please contact us directly). Each participant will purchase their choice of paint in a color that will match their decor and the appropriate finish product. Brushes are available for purchase, or you may bring your own.  Workshop includes, instruction and  guidance provided by our paint experts, snacks, beverage and light lunch.

Modern Calligraphy by Angelique Ink.name: Modern Calligraphy by Angelique Ink
Modern Calligraphy by Angelique Ink.description: Learn the art of Modern Calligraphy with Angi of Angelique Ink in a three hour workshop, where you'll get to explore the tools and proper techniques of modern pointed pen calligraphy. We'll go over everything from technique of basic pen strokes to proper letter construction, connecting letters, and tips on styling and composition, so you can walk away with everything you need for developing your skill and style. Each student will receive a complete take-home calligraphy supply set, curated by Angi which includes her instructional guide book with alphabet exemplars and styling tips. This is a really fun, no-pressure workshop for anyone interested in learning a new skill, honing their skill, picking up a fun hobby, artist looking to try a new technique/medium, or just something fun to try with friends. Workshop includes all materials needed, a take home kit, snacks and sips.

Leather Envelope Pocket Wallet.name: Leather Envelope Pocket Wallet
Leather Envelope Pocket Wallet.description:
Learn to craft your very own envelope pocket wallet made from vegetable tanned leather. Paul of Middleclassy will walk you through the basics of leathercrafting: from saddlestitching to edge finishing. By the end of the workshop you'll have a one of a kind handmade leather wallet that will only become nicer over time by slowly getting softer while developing a unique patina. 


No experience necessary. 


All materials will be provided to make and take home your own envelope pocket wallet. Tools will be provided to be used in the workshop only.


Paul and his assistant and will make sure that you leave home with something you’re proud of.


This workshop is all about teaching you the basics so that you can start to tackle bigger and more complicated projects. Are you up for a challenge and learning a new skill? Register today, spaces are limited. 
*Space is limited. Registration in advance is required. Please make sure you are able to attend the workshop date, as refunds will not be given once purchase is made.
**In the event that the workshop does not meet a minimum capacity-- guests who have registered will be notified via email for cancellation 2 days prior to the event

Advanced Studio Lighting and Posing (Por.name: Advanced Studio Lighting and Posing (Portrait and Fashion) with Joe & Mirta Barnet - SA
Advanced Studio Lighting and Posing (Por.description:
This 5 hour class, using professional studio gear will deal with more complex lighting, using three, four, or more light sources. Students will photograph the model with provided PocketWizard triggering devices. In a controlled studio environment, your creativity is the only limit to what you can achieve. This workshop will take the mystery out of working with professional studio lighting, modifiers and metering.
If you don’t have experience working in the studio, or with off camera flash units larger than speedlights, attending our Beginning Studio Lighting and Posing (Portrait and Fashion) before this workshop is highly recommended.
Topics covered: We will work with self contained AC and battery powered Profoto D1 and B1 monoblocks, as well as power packs and heads. We’ll use umbrellas, soft boxes and reflectors, as well as a beauty dish and a ring flash for more edgy and fashion oriented lighting and posing. We’ll set up kickers, background lights, high-key, gobos and color gels. Background selection and posing techniques will be discussed. We’ll talk about different lighting patterns and styles and work with hand held light meters for consistent accurate exposures.

Adventures Worth Exploring 2018.name: Adventures Worth Exploring 2018
Adventures Worth Exploring 2018.description:
DISCOVER YOUR NEXT ULTIMATE ADVENTURE!
Saturday, March 3, 2018 - NEW DATEAnaheim Convention Center, Anaheim, CA
Don't just surf the world wide web, start exploring a world of wide opportunities.  Now is the time to come and get inspired by 100+ amazing experiences, presented in a first-of-its-kind event at Adventures Worth Exploring.
We’ve assembled an incredible array of unconventional adventures that are all designed to change the way you see the world…as an exciting place to explore!  Our all-ages, all-day, all-genders, all-inclusive event will feature adventures near and far, big and small, fun and challenging, down and dirty, luxurious and gritty…and all of them will knock your socks off!
Imagine going to Cowboy College, or taking part in a Covert Ops mission with the CIA. Live like a celebrity, sing like a Broadway star, or learn how to be a model.  Become a barista or brew your own craft beer. Fight like a ninja warrior, learn to fend off zombies, or solve a murder mystery.  There will be so much to explore at Adventures Worth Exploring, you will be AWE’d beyond your wildest imagination.
Get more information on our website by clicking here.
 


FAQs... because, "knowing is half the battle."

Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?
There is not.  Everyone is invited!  That being said, there will be limited activities available for smaller kids.  One adult to one cherub ratio is recommended for everyone's comfort.
 
What are my transportation/parking options for getting to and from the event?
Parking for all ticket types is on your own.  Please review your options on the venue's website.  We will send out discount transportation codes for your favorite rider apps as the event gets closer.  Public transportation and carpool are always recommended.  Beep, beep.
 
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Email us, we're here to help.  Please give us one business day to respond.  
 
What's the cancellation and refund policy?
Complimentary tickets can be canceled anytime.  A refund is available for paid tickets before February 3, 2018.  Starting on February 4, 2017, refunds for paid tickets are not available based on commitments made assuming your participation.  Please contact us to cancel paid tickets.  Email us here.
 
Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?
No.  As long as you register using the actual name(s) of your folks who are coming we will be able to look them up.  You can also save your ticket to your Apple or Andriod Wallet.  
 
Is my registration fee or ticket transferrable?
Sure.  You can modify your registration any time through Eventbrite.  Log into Eventbrite to edit the name(s) and/or information of your participant(s).
 
Is it ok if the name on my ticket or registration doesn't match the person who attends?
Sure, but it may require additional time at onsite check-in.  You can modify your registration any time through Eventbrite.  Log into Eventbrite to edit the name(s) and/or information of your participant(s).

How many tickets can I get?
For complimentary tickets, the limit is five.  Ten is the limit for paid tickets.  Need more?  Email us here.

ISHA - Newport BeachSoCal Lectures with.name: ISHA - Newport Beach/SoCal Lectures with Ishwar Puri - 2018
ISHA - Newport BeachSoCal Lectures with.description:
After pressing "Register" (or "Tickets" if on a mobile device), SELECT THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE YOU WANT TO REGISTER, NOT THE NUMBER OF DAYS.

We look forward to seeing you.

Family Reunion - MDDC Regional Awards &.name: Family Reunion - MD/DC Regional Awards & Celebration at Disneyland California Adventure Park
Family Reunion - MDDC Regional Awards &.description:
Join us for an evening of rides, fun, drinks and appetizers as we celebrate your 2017 accomplishments!
8:00-10:00- Enjoy all that Disneyland Adventure park has to offer**:
Sail up and over the beaming face of Mickey Mouse aboard the spin-sational Ferris wheel. 
Sample splendid varietals from California and around the world with the advice of a wine expert atthe patio wine bar, Mendocino Terrace.

AND SO MUCH MORE!

After exploring the park come to Stage 17 for our private awards reception with drinks and appetizers!

Tribute to Jack Nichols, Colette Gardner.name: Tribute to Jack Nichols, Colette Gardner and Chris Gregory
Tribute to Jack Nichols, Colette Gardner.description:
The Founder's District lost three lifelong Toastmasters, leaders and friends within the last 6 months: Jack Nichols, Colette Gardner and Chris Gregory.
To commemorate their service to the District and remember the times we shared with them, you are invited to a tribute event on Wednesday, January 31, 2018 at the Mesa Verde United Methodist Church, 1701 Baker St, Costa Mesa, CA 92626.
Meeting venue will be open at 6pm, and light refreshments will be served at 6:30pm. The event will start at 7pm and end at 9pm. 
Please send this link to anyone who would appreciate being informed about this. Your presence will make this celebration of life a success.
Hosted by the Founder's District Speakers Bureau, under the supervision of the Founder's District of Toastmasters International.



If you would like to make donations to contribute to the success of this celebration, two channels are available:
1. In cash at the event venue on event day

Online Teaching Conference 2018.name: Online Teaching Conference 2018
Online Teaching Conference 2018.description:
The Online Teaching Conference, which began nearly 17 years ago, is an event for faculty, staff and administrators who are engaged  or interested in online education, including delivery of online services, emerging technologies, student success, library and technical support.  In addition to learning, this conference is a great opportunity for educators to spend two or three days with colleagues, share knowledge, impart and receive best practices, and learn from other's experiences.

BI + Analytics, Feb 19-21.name: BI + Analytics, Feb. 19-21
BI + Analytics, Feb 19-21.description:
BI + Analytics Conference http://biaconference.com/ February 19-21, 2018, Huntington Beach, CA
BI + Analytics Conference (formerly known as SABOC), is a celebration of the people, technology, ideas, and innovations that are powering constant change in the way we live and work.
Imagine for a second, one of these scenarios: giving a presentation on a brand-new idea, sitting with the team evaluating this week’s efficacy, brainstorming with clients to come up with that game-changing strategy, or planning that next big purchase for the department. Many years ago, these may have been decided and completed with very few metrics and limited data. Fast forward to today, where data and immediate strategic insights are imperative to driving real business outcomes and making nearly every decision.
Developing a BI and analytics strategy equipped with powerful capabilities like speed, reporting and insight driven visualizations can provide your business with the strategic edge to succeed.
BI+Analytics gives you access to global thought leaders, local peers, and industry experts using BusinessObjects and the full range of SAP’s analytics and reporting tools. You will learn how to lead with analytics, maximize your current software investments, empower super users and create a BI strategy and analytics team that exceeds the needs of the business. Keep up-to-date on conference content and updates by following @BIAconference on Twitter and @EventfulConferences on Instagram.

Some important things to know and frequently asked questions!

Can I pay by invoice?
Yes, please call the team at Eventful Conferences at +1.914.509.5354

Can I send teams?Yes, we offer discounted team rates for groups of three or more. For teams larger than 10 or for international pricing please call Eventful Conferences at +1.914.509.5354
For vendors (Software, Service, Consulting or similar organizations) who are not sponsoring the event but interested in sending people, Eventful Conferences reserves the right to limit to a maximum of two full delegate passes. Please call Eventful Conferences at +1.914.509.5354 for details.

What does my registration include?


Entry into the event and exhibition hall


Access to all general admission tracks


A digital copy of all presentations upon completion of short a post-event survey


Access to networking functions and special events


Food and beverage


*  Where applicable, base registration does not include access to Hands-On Sessions or Workshops*

What is the Networking List?
The networking list is offered two ways:


In the event app as a feature that makes it easy for all event attendees to connect with their peers and facilitate meetings during the event


As an Excel document, sharable post-event for delegates and sponsoring partners


You will be prompted to join or opt-out of the networking list during registration.

Can I pay by another method?Yes, simply call or email Eventful Conferences for details on how to pay by check, wire, or if you need PO details. Please be aware that all invoices need to be settled 48 hours before the event.

Can I update my registration information?Yes, just call or email us.

Is my registration transferable?Yes. If you are unable to attend, you can transfer your registration to someone else in your team. Just call or email.

Can I cancel my registration?Yes. However, cancellations can only be made up to 28 days before the start of the event, after which time only alternate delegates will be accepted. All requests need to be directed to the Eventful Conferences sales team.

To contact Eventful Conferences:Call us at +1.914.509.5354Email general inquiries to info@eventfulconferences.comEmail sales questions to delegatesales@eventfulconferences.comEmail sponsor questions to sponsorsales@eventfulconferences.comEmail registration questions to register@eventfulconferences.com

Visit us at www.eventfulconferences.com

Please note that Eventful Conferences reserves the right of admission.

Orthotic Fitter Course (Orange County, C.name: Orthotic Fitter Course (Orange County, CA)
Orthotic Fitter Course (Orange County, C.description:
Are You Interested in Becoming Certified as an Orthotic Fitter?
The Orthotic Fitter is an important part of the medical team. Following a physician’s order or prescription, an Orthotic Fitter properly fits, dispenses, and adjusts off-the-shelf (OTS) orthotic devices or braces. Trained and Certified Orthotic Fitters are integral to the physical and emotional well-being of patients, providing training and instruction on how to properly use and maintain their OTS orthotic devices.
Össur’s Orthotic Fitter Course is an entry-level prerequisite program for those wishing to sit for the exam and upon passing become an ABC Certified Fitter-orthotics (CFo) or a BOC Certified Orthotic Fitter (COF). ABC-certified individuals will receive (30) Category II Scientific and (2) Category II Business continuing education credits for full participation in this course. This 32-hour course is also BOC approved as a refresher course for (37) Category 1 and (0.5) Category 2 credits. This course will provide preparation for direct patient care, including patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow up and practice management.
Terms & Conditions:
Participants will not receive completion certificates if they do not attend all 4 days. (The completion certificate is a required prerequisite to sit for the orthotic fitter exam).
Össur is not responsible for fees associated with certification exams.
Cancellations: A cancellation will result in forfeiture of $600 payment.
Intellectual Property Rights: Video or audio recording of the scheduled event is strictly prohibited, unless otherwise permitted. All intellectual rights in all materials produced or distributed by Össur Americas in connection to this event.
For more information on the certification process including fitting hours, please visit:
 https://www.abcop.org/individual-certification/Pages/orthotic-fitter.aspx
 http://www.bocusa.org/cof-certification-process

Frank R Bowerman Landfill Tour - Irvine,.name: Frank R. Bowerman Landfill Tour - Irvine, CA
Frank R Bowerman Landfill Tour - Irvine,.description:
Welcome to the Frank R. Bowerman Landfill Tour Reservation page. Please see important information below and select your preferred date and time at the top right. You will receive email confirmation or someone will contact you with any questions. Enjoy the tour!
IMPORTANT TOUR INFORMATION:


Every person on the tour must print and sign a waiver, and bring it with to the tour. Landfill staff may shoot photos during the tour. If willing to be photographed, please sign the Photo Model Release form on the back of the waiver. Photos of tours may be used in the OC Waste & Recycling Annual Report and/or in digital and print informational materials. Click the link for a waiver form: Frank R. Bowerman Landfill Waiver.


OC Waste & Recycling (OCWR) requires each visitor to wear closed-toe shoes and long pants are desirable over shorts or dresses.


Each tour lasts approximately 90 minutes, including a pre-tour presentation, review of safety rules, and van tour.


The maximum number of visitors per tour is 14.


Please contact OC Waste & Recycling to make special arrangements for larger groups or for any special needs and accommodations. The contact link is at the bottom of this page above the map. 
Please note: Groups of 15 or more may need to provide a van or bus and must be arranged separately.

FAQs
Age Restrictions and WaiverChildren must be at least five years old. California Child Passenger Safety law applies. Guests are responsible for bringing car seats when applicable. 
Parents must sign for children under the age of 18. Signed waivers must be brought to the site on the day of the tour.
Parking & DirectionsCarpooling is advised as parking is limited. Access is available from the Santa Ana Freeway (I-5) or the San Diego Freeway (I-405). Exit at Sand Canyon Avenue. The major cross street is Portola Parkway.
When approaching the Frank R. Bowerman Landfill entrance, please stay in the far right lane and enter the Landfill Office parking lot. DO NOT ENTER THE TRUCK TOLL BOOTH ENTRANCE. 
Survey
Please follow the link below to take a survey about your Landfill Tour experience.
Landfill Tour Experience Survey

3-Day This ticket included 2-days of Camp AND adds an additional 3rd day (Thursday) for a $150 fee, to work alongside Illuminators on any area learned or needed, in support of the System Admin.

Is there a Camp Orientation?
There are 2 oritnetation meetings availabe pre-camp. Choose and register for one session prior to Bootcamp.

What are my transportation/parking options for getting to and from the event?
The campground or Illuminate Irvine Office is within reach from John Wayne (SNA) Airport and depending on the local hotels, a short uber ride away.
 
What can I bring into the event?

A laptop is required
A smile
Snacks/Lunch
An Illuminate User login, preferably of System Admin role and permissions

 
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
You can always talk with your Implementation Manager about if Camp ISI is best for you! Your Camp Directors Annie Stefano and Rebecca Coleman are available if you have direct questions.

Annie Stefano astefano@illuminateed.com
Rebecca Coleman rcoleman@illuminateed.com

2018 Student Learning Outcomes (SLO) Sym.description:
The 5th Annual Student Learning Outcomes (SLO) Symposium will be held Friday, February 9th, 2018 at Orange Coast College. Over 200 attendees are expected at the 5th Annual SLO Symposium. Faculty, faculty coordinators, researchers, administrators and research analysts attended the event in the past. This year, we are expecting ten breakout sessions per hour and topics such as: ACCJC and what’s new with SLO assessment, SLO assessment data disaggregation, how to make SLO assessment consequential, building teams and focus groups around SLOs and how to engage students and faculty in meaningful SLO assessment processes are going to be among the topics discussed. We also anticipate vendors who will present newest updates in their software programs designed to keep track of SLO assessments and student progress. Breakfast and lunch are included in the registration fee. Hope to see you there!

Self-Love Talk.name: Self-Love Talk
Self-Love Talk.description:
Join me as I share my journey to writing Table for One: Let Go of Unfulfilling Relationships and Embrace Being Single and how I embarked on my own path to self-love and how you can to.
 
Here’s what you can expect:
* I’ll reveal my journey to writing Table for One and how it became a catalyst for my own healing and self-love to help empower you to chart your own course to a more fulfilling life.
* I’ll read excerpts from the book covering key principles to help you overcome your fear, inspire forgiveness, and deepen your self-love as you move forward in your relationships.
*We’ll reflect on key questions to dive deeper into the principles discussed to provide you with tools and actionable steps to integrate self-love into your everyday life.
* We’ll wrap up with a live Q&A and book signing.
* Ticket includes 1 copy of Table for One. 
This intimate event will provide you with a better understanding of the important role self-love plays in all areas of your life and how you too can learn to truly love yourself.
Space is limited so be sure to purchase your ticket(s) as soon as possible. Tickets will not be available for purchase at the event. 
Please note that tickets are nonrefundable, but they are transferable. If you are unable to attend the event your book cannot be shipped.

Let Go & Embrace.name: Let Go & Embrace
Let Go & Embrace.description:
Are you struggling to let go?
Would you like to be better at embracing your truth?
Could you use a little more self-love in your life?
Are you ready for some "me" time?

Let Go & Embrace is an intimate event in which I'll share more about my personal journey of letting go of the negative crap in my life, including fears and false lies that held me back from my dreams and kept me stuck in unfulfilling relationships, and how I embraced self-love in order to live a more authentic life.
If you are ready to wrap your mind around new things; to let go of your inhibitions, insecurities and false beliefs about who you are; and embrace your truth, femininity and self-love, this event is for you.
As a Let Go & Embrace attendee you’ll experience the following:
  * Welcome Mixer
  * Introduction to Pole Dance Class
  * Swag Bag & Raffle Drawing
  * Small Bites & Wine Tasting
  * Self-Love Talk & Author Signing (copy of book included) 
My book, Table for One was written to help women like you who struggle with self-love, who have allowed fear to keep you feeling stuck, and created this event to share my journey so that you know you are not alone—to help you see that it is possible to love you first.
Space is limited so be sure to purchase your ticket(s) as soon as possible. Please note that there are no refunds once tickets have been purchased.

Event hosted by Jennifer L Moudy

First Impressions: There Can Be Only One.name: First Impressions: There Can Be Only One!
First Impressions: There Can Be Only One.description: Do you feel like you have blown it with someone if you had a bad first impression? Do you hear the little voice in your head beating yourself up for “messing up”? Do you see no way of redeeming yourself?Never fear! All is not lost! Sure it may seem bleak and no way of “fixing” the situation. There are ways of salvaging it though.Of course you want to skip all that and have a good first impression to begin with. What if you could have a tool to start you off on the right foot?One such tool to have a great first impression is called rapport. Rapport is the ability to relate to others in a way that creates trust and understanding.Would you like to find out how to use rapport to feel at ease and have a great first impression? Also, how to use rapport to move you beyond a bad first impression and have an awesome interaction and connection?Come out to our next meeting. It’s time to enjoy the amazing connections that you have always wanted, isn’t it? Bring a friend. RSVP now while there are still seats available.

Ted Chiang: Author of Arrival.name: Ted Chiang: Author of Arrival
Ted Chiang: Author of Arrival.description:
Public Reading and Q & A  6-7:30 p.m., followed by book signingTed Chiang was born in Port Jefferson, New York, and holds a degree in computer science. In 1989 he attended the Clarion Science Fiction and Fantasy Writer’s Workshop. His fiction has won four Hugo, four Nebula, and four Locus awards, and he is the recipient of the John W. Campbell Award for Best New Writer and the Theodore Sturgeon Memorial Award. Stories of Your Life and Others has been translated into ten languages. He lives near Seattle, Washington.
The New Yorker has published the most in-depth profile of Ted Chiang to date, starting with the 1990s when Chiang first began writing short stories, including “Story of Your Life” which was recently turned into the hit movie Arrival. Knopf republished Chiang’s collection STORIES OF YOUR LIFE AND OTHERS June 14, 2016 and it is currently at number 13 on the New York Times Trade Paperback bestseller list.
Follow the link below to read the profile in full:http://www.newyorker.com/culture/persons-of-interest/ted-chiangs-soulful…

Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) - I.name: Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) - Irvine, CA
Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) - I.description:
Learn the secrets of the most successful Scrum Product Owners
What happens when you and your team deliver a monster project—after living and breathing it for days, weeks or months—only to realize it’s no longer needed, not what the client wants, or doesn’t provide the value you expected? Probably nothing good.
Get off that treadmill and discover how you can quickly figure out where to start, get feedback fast, and recognize what to do next. This two-day Certified Scrum Product Owner® (CSPO) course offers you a new way to think about complexity and change. You’ll gain the ability to identify early value and mitigate risk, even on large projects, and become a more effective Product Owner for any Scrum team.
Come prepared to participate! Instead of death-by-PowerPoint, Agile For All’s brain-friendly training style means you’ll dig deep into a real-world project, learn by doing, and practice your new skills.
You’ll discover how to harness complexity and change for your advantage. You’ll see how to build learning into your projects. And you’ll find new ways to communicate effectively with your team and stakeholders.
With successful course completion, you achieve the designation of Scrum Alliance Certified Scrum Product Owner®.
Register for CSPO Training – Scroll Up to Order Now
 
Course Topics & Learning Objectives
Take advantage of our industry experience and immerse yourself in the major skillsets and practices you need to succeed as a Scrum Product Owner. Throughout this CSPO course, you’ll:

Explore the mindset mindset of an effective Product Owner, especially how to think about complexity and change and their impact on projects, products, and planning
Understand the role of the Product Owner in the Scrum Framework
Learn key practices and tools for Product Owners not covered in Scrum, including what’s required to build and maintain a good product backlog

By the end of our time together, you’ll be able to:


Define good Product Ownership and illustrate that definition with examples from your own experience


Explain the Scrum Framework with emphasis on the Product Owner’s role in it


Explain why things are predictable sometimes and not others—and how to tell the difference in advance


Explain the seven Lean Disciplines and what they have to do with effective Product Ownership


Describe how to structure work for a project or product to benefit from change


Write a clear Product Vision statement


Use Feature Mining to find a first slice of a big idea (such as a project or new product) that will produce early value, learning and/or risk mitigation


Write clear, valuable user stories


Slice big user stories into small ones


Structure a product backlog to have just the right amount of detail at the right time—not too early or too late


Forecast a release (date/scope) over a product backlog and account for risk


Register for CSPO Training – Scroll Up to Order Now

Who Should Attend
This course is for you if:


You’re Product Owner on a struggling project and want to find your smartest next step FAST


You’re Product Owner for an IT team with multiple systems and diverse stakeholders and you need tools to make everybody happy while maximizing value for your organization


You have a big idea for a new product or project but you don’t know where to start


You’re a ScrumMaster who wants to help your Product Owner be more effective in their role


You’re making the transition from traditional product management to an agile approach

You just want to take your Product Ownership skills to the next level

Register for CSPO Training – Scroll Up to Order Now

Professional Development Units (PDU) for PMPs
Project management professionals can get 14 PDUs for this CSPO course. All CSPO courses from Agile For All are taught by Certified Scrum Trainers. Successfully completing a CSPO course and accepting the license agreement designates you as a Certified Scrum Product Owner and indicates you’ve been introduced to and understand the basic concepts needed to perform as Product Owner on a Scrum team.
Register for CSPO Training – Scroll Up to Order Now

About the Course Facilitator Richard Lawrence

Co-owner of Agile For All, Richard Lawrence trains and coaches teams and organizations to become happier and more productive. From his diverse background in software development, engineering, anthropology, and political science, he helps people think more deeply about humanizing workplaces and collaborating effectively with each other on complex work.
Richard is a Scrum Alliance Certified Enterprise Coach and a Certified Scrum Trainer, as well as a certified trainer of the Training from the Back of the Room accelerated learning method. His book Behavior-Driven Development with Cucumber will be published later this year by Addison-Wesley.
 
Onsite Courses & Training 
Bring this training into your organization! Agile For All comes to you with onsite training workshops by some of the top Scrum Alliance Certified Enterprise Coaches and a Certified Scrum Trainers. For information about private workshops, group discounts or questions, contact us or call 303-766-0917.
 

 

What Participants Say

“This course presented a variety of techniques and skills to help me become a better Product Owner. The subject matter was directly applicable to my role.”
“The hands-on and interactive design of this training helped me learn how to apply the knowledge gained.”
“Very engaging instructor – great use of examples and humor gets points across.”

Just 4 days to CSPO and CSM Certification – Save $200!
“FastTrack” your Agile skills and receive both Certified Scrum Product Owner® and Certified ScrumMaster® training at this location in only 4 days. Find out how to get our FastTrack discount by emailing info@agileforall.com or calling 303-766-0917.
 
Register for CSPO Training – Scroll Up to Order Now

Illuminate Education Workshop: Elementar.name: Illuminate Education Workshop: Elementary Report Card Training SOCAL (2-Days)
Illuminate Education Workshop: Elementar.description:
Ready to get next year started with Illuminate Report Cards? This is a group training opportunity for districts who are transitioning to Illuminate Report Cards for the 2018-2019 school year. This package of support includes a live workshop, in-person training lead by Illuminate Education along with Illuminator Check-ins, virtual support, and Go-Live Entry support for your first entry date! Refer to this document for details: https://goo.gl/CtC4ZT. 
**This is a 2-Day Workshop**
This workshop is intended for district representatives responsible for building and maintaining Elementary Report Cards in Illuminate for the 2018-2019 school year. Ticket options include:

Individual Workshop ticket, $500 per person
Group Workshop ticket for Districts/LEAs sending 3 or more, $1500 total

It is vital and required to have a completed final draft of the report card (PDF pref, an editable copy helpful) for at least one grade level (all are preferred and highly recommended). 
In addition, you must have rolled over for the 2018-2019 school year.
Contact your Implementation Manager for details and questions about the next steps in your Report Card process. 
 
FAQs 
What can I bring into the event?

A laptop is preferred, not a smart device
A smile
Final PDF of all elementary report cards
Awareness and understanding of where data is expected to populate from
Awareness and access to data needed for building

Why Do I Rollover?
Rolling over creates a shell of next year to build within. You don't need student data, but need the academic year to exist to build next year's report cards. You can learn how to rollover for DNA or ISI.
How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Feel free to contact your Implementaion Manager. They are your primary contact to best advised and support you and your implementation goals.

World Class Cyber Incident Response Plan.name: World Class Cyber Incident Response Plans: Strong Responses to Attacks (com) A
World Class Cyber Incident Response Plan.description:
World Class Cyber Incident Response Plans: Strong Responses to Attacks

*** LIMITED TIME OFFER: FREE $100 AMAZON GIFT CARD! ***REGISTER TODAY! 



Cyber-attacks and incidents affect every aspect of an organization, often disrupting normal business which affects our customers/members and possibly the integrity of payment processing causing financial loss, lawsuits, brand damage, and more. A poor response to cyber-incidents is often more devastating than the attack itself, yet many organizations report they do not have an appropriate cyber incident response plan. Only by careful planning, documenting and testing can we effectively protect our customers/members, payment processes, and the organization’s reputation.
The workshop explores the effects of cyber-attacks and sound mitigation strategies necessary for effective cyber-incident response from multiple perspectives including Operations, Call Center, Vendor Management, and more. This course is intended for a varied audience as we explore the people, processes, and payment integrity aspects of responding to today’s cyber-threats.
NOTE: This is NOT a technical networking or network infrastructure workshop.
Attendees will receive a sample Security Incident Response Plan (developed by law firm Stinson Leonard Street, LLP), plus other valuable take-away, resources and action items.



Seminar Fee Includes:


Lunch
AM-PM Tea/Coffee
Seminar Material
USB with seminar presentation
Hard copy of presentation
Attendance Certificate
$100 Gift Cert for next seminar





Learning Objectives:

Develop an effective Incident Response Team
Correlate critical components of an effective Cyber Incident Response Plan
Isolate operational challenges and counter-actions
Document critical provisions of any crisis communication program
Record action items from unique perspectives
Create appropriate responses to mock cyber incidents



Areas Covered:


Incident response teams
Mapping processes
Risks related to reliance on critical vendors
Cyber response by function (i.e. call centre vs. operations)
Developing plans
Crisis communications program
Management and the Board
Case studies



Who will Benefit:


Management
Director
Payments
Operations
Call Center
Information Security
Risk Management
Trainers
Disaster Recovery
Special Projects
Examiner
Legal
Audit / Compliance



--------------
AGENDA--------------

DAY 01(8:30 AM - 4:00 PM)



8:30 am - 9:00 am: Registration

Attendees help develop the course agenda by identifying their unique questions, needs, perspectives, experiences, etc.


9:00 am – 10:15 am: Introduction to Cyber Incident Response Plans

Define
Incident Response Teams

Critical functional areas to involve
Team considerations


Critical assets and processes
Plans’ motivation(s)


10:15 am – 10:30 am: Break
10:30 am – 12:00 Noon: Plan Development

Inherent risks by industry
Risks presented by vendors / solution providers
Mapping processes
Unique response needs by functional area
Escalation plans
Board and Exec. Management involvement
Plan testing
Board reports
Involving external partners – vendors, law enforcement, experts
Bringing it all together


12:00 Noon – 12:45 pm: Lunch
12:45 pm – 1:30 pm: Plan Development continued
1:30 pm – 1:45 pm: Break
1:45 pm – 4:00 pm: Crisis Communication Program

Three stages of effective crisis communication
Tips on analyzing the program
How Leadership team supports an effective crisis communication program
The Crisis Communications Checklist






DAY 02(9:00 AM - 11:30 AM)



9:00 am – 9:15 am: Questions and thoughts from Day 1
9:15 am – 11:00 am: Workshops and roundtables

Group exercises – Cases simulate real situations. Cases are all true situations where attacks resulted in significant operational issues and significant losses. Attack details are provided throughout, simulating an actual incident where not all details or evidence is apparent during the initial attack. Attendees, working in cyber incident response teams, will work through studies to define appropriate courses of action and identify potential pitfalls.


11:00 am – 11:30 am: Conclusion

Group discussion of findings and recommendations
Final questions, resources, review takeaways




-----------------SPEAKERS-----------------



Rayleen M Pirnie,CEO, RP Payments Risk Consulting Services LLC

Rayleen is the founder and owner of RP Payments Risk Consulting Services, LLC. based in Missouri. She is a nationally recognized payments risk and fraud expert who offers specialized consulting services, procedural and risk management reviews, and payments education. Rayleen’s specialized skill is delving into the world beyond the payment rules; areas where organizations often find themselves in positions of liability or loss with little to no clear guidance. Her programs help organizations identify and mitigate risk and exposure. She is an Accredited ACH Professional (AAP) who has worked with all payment systems for nearly 20 years.
Ms. Pirnie also holds a Bachelor’s of Science in Criminal Justice Administration. Her educational programs provide real-world, actionable information for financial institutions and businesses on topics ranging from payments risk management to information security. She authors payments risk and fraud blogs geared toward helping organizations recognize threats and protect themselves from loss.






Michael Barrio,Vice President, Public Affairs, Leverage Point Inc.

Michael Barrio is a communications and public affairs specialist with extensive experience with the credit union, entertainment, and high-tech industries. He spent several years in Los Angeles, CA and gained extensive expertise in corporate human resources, organizational development & alignment, and media relations during his tenure at The Walt Disney Co. and Yahoo!, Inc. Michael also taught at New Mexico State University as an adjunct professor in Business & Professional Communication, Technical & Scientific Communication, Contemporary Identity Politics, and all levels of composition. He is passionate about professional and corporate ethics, and remains a continuing Daniels Fund Ethics Initiative Fellow and advocate. Michael’s

Who Do We Think We Are? American Identit.name: Who Do We Think We Are? American Identity and the Ideal of Democracy in the 21st century
Who Do We Think We Are? American Identit.description:
This two-day event will be held at following locations:
Friday, February 9 at 4:00 PM - Crystal Cove Auditorium, UCI Student Center
Saturday, February 10 at 9:30 AM - UCI School of Law, EDU 1111




“Who Do We Think We Are?: American Identity and the Ideal of Democracy in the 21st Century”
Keynote Speaker: Jill Lepore, Harvard University and The New Yorker
Author of The Secret History of Wonder Woman
The United States is facing a peculiar time in which it’s unusually difficult to take stock of ourselves. If we had to say what underpins America today, if we were forced to choose our core beliefs or values as a nation, it’s not clear that we could readily do so. Do we still believe, for example, in liberty, life, and the pursuit of happiness? That all men are created equal? Do we still believe in the right to religious freedom? In free speech and freedom of the press? How about our electoral system? Due process? Do we still believe in democracy and representative government? Do we still care, or even give lip-service to caring, about the poor, the marginalized, the vulnerable at home and around the world? Do we still hesitate to use weapons of mass destruction? These are all questions with which the Trump presidency, the rise of the extreme right and recent gerrymandering lawsuits have forced us to reckon. Do we instead believe, with the president, that might and money should rule the country and the world? Do we believe that political parties have the right to shape the electorate to keep themselves in power? Do we believe that some Americans are more American than others? Our keynote speaker and our panels, which comprise thinkers and visionaries from all over the world along with a diverse group of American experts, will focus on the many complicated ways to address and to answer the most important question of all: Who Do We Think We Are?


Free and open to the public. Presented by the Forum for the Academy and the Public. Sponsored by Illuminations: The Chancellor's Arts and Culture Initiative, the Program in Literary Journalism, the UCI School of Law, and the Humanities Commons. For event information, please contact Amanda Swain, ajswain@uci.edu. Parking at UCI Student Center (Friday) and Social Sciences Parking Structure (Saturday)
